loans.name: Yasmin Jordany

texts.es:
Yasmin es una joven de 23 años la cual es muy trabajadora y sobre todo entusiasta y optimista, es madre de un pequeño de 6 años, por el cual ella se esfuerza mucho y sobre todo lo ha sacado adelante sola ya que el padre de su hijo la abandono y se convirtió en madre y padre para él. Su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Nazca, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima muy cálido además de tener a “Las Líneas de Nazca”, las cuales son dibujos extensos en medio de un campo grande y árido las cuales son visitadas por infinidad de turistas en todo el año. Cuando tiene un tiempo libre le gusta escuchar música sobre todo al lado de su pequeño ya que comienzan a cantar y aunque no lo hacen muy bien se divierten mucho, así también le gusta disfrutar su platillo favorito el cual es el riquísimo “Ceviche”.

Con entusiasmo Yasmin trabaja en su negocio de venta Hamburguesas y también a la pesca artesanal, ella trabaja alrededor de 6 horas diarias y puede atender hasta 15 clientes en el día, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque trabaja con gusto y con ganas de salir adelante.

Yasmin está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá dar un mantenimiento a su bote en especial pintarlo, instalar el motor y realizar la inscripción del mismo, así ella podrá mejorar sus ingresos y también mejorar su calidad de vida para seguir luchando y hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Construir su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Yasmin, 23, is a hard-working, young woman who is especially enthusiastic and optimistic.  She is the mother of a six-year-old son and makes every effort to raise him on her own, since the boy's father left them and she had to become both mother and father.  Her house is located in the city of Nazca which is known for its warm climate and for the "Líneas de Nazca" (Nazca Lines), which are extensive drawings in the middle of a large, dry field which is visited by many tourists every year.  In her free time she enjoys listening to music with her little boy, since they begin to sing and have fun even though they don't sing very well.  She also enjoys eating her favorite dish, which is the delicious "Ceviche".

Yasmin works with enthusiasm at her hamburguer business and is also active in artisan fishing.  She works about six hours and attends to up to 15 customers a day.  She believes business is doing so well because she enjoys it and is determined to get ahead.

Yasmin is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because, through their help, she has been able to provide maintenance for her boat (paint, motor and registration).  This will enable her to improve her income and quality of life to continue striving toward her goal of: "Building her own house".

loans.use: To pay for boat maintenance (paint, motor and registration).

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
La socia Alejandrina nació en la ciudad de Anta de la provincia del Anta del departamento de Cusco y vive donde nació. Alejandrina actualmente tiene 59 años de edad y es casada y fruto de esa unión tiene ocho hijos. Sus actividades económicas de la socia Alejandrina son la agricultura, la ganadería y el comercio entonces ella se dedica a la venta de comida y crianza de animales menores, ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos, verduras y otras cosas más. 

La socia Alejandrina pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen Inmaculada Concepción de Anta” de la Asociación Arariwa de la provincia del Cusco.
texts.en:
Alejandrina was born and lives in the city of Anta, province of Anta in the department of Cusco.  She is 59 years old, married and has eight children.  Her business activities are agriculture, livestock farming and commerce.  She sells food and raises small animals.  On this occasion she is requesting a loan to buy goods such as rice, sugar, noodles, vegetables and other items.

Alejandrina is a member of the communal bank "Virgen Inmaculada Concepción de Anta" which belongs to the Arariwa Association in the province of Cusco.

loans.use: To buy goods such as rice, sugar, noodles, vegetables and other items.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
La socia Marcelina nació en la ciudad de Anta de la provincia del Anta del departamento de Cusco y vive donde nació. Marcelina tiene 47 años de edad y es casada y fruto de esa unión tiene dos hijos. Sus actividades económicas de la socia Marcelina son la agricultura, la ganadería y el comercio entonces ella se dedica  a la venta de comida y crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo gallinas y cuyes, ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar gallinas. Su sueño de Marcelina es abrir un restaurante.  

La socia Marcelina pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen Inmaculada Concepción de Anta” de la Asociación Arariwa de la provincia del Cusco.
texts.en:
Marcelina was born and lives in the city of Anta, province of Anta, in the department of Cusco.  She is 47, married and has two children.  She is economically active in agriculture, livestock farming and commerce.  She sells food and raises small animals such as chickens and guinea pigs.  On this occasion she is requesting a loan to buy chickens.  Marcelina's goal is to open a restaurant.

Marcelina is a member of the communal bank "Virgen Inmaculada Concepción de Anta", which belongs to the Arariwa Association in the Cusco Province.

loans.use: To buy chickens.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is 70 years old and married with eight children.

Fe works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, such as shampoo, groceries, etc. in her general store.

Fe has borrowed and paid 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 30 years and also earns an income from tailoring.

Fe aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy items to sell

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 24 years old.  She is married to Duncan, and they have one child, who is seven years old.  She operates a beauty salon and has been in the business for the past four years.

This is her first loan from KADET LTD.  She was introduced by one of KADET LTD's clients.  She will use the loan amount to purchase hair weaves, hair relaxer, and also pay her workers.

She hopes to own a large salon so that she can increase her income.

loans.use: To purchase hair weaves, hair relaxer, and also pay her workers

loans.name: Yadira Del Carmen

texts.es:
Doña Yadira, es casada y tiene 49 años de edad,  propietaria de su propio negocio consiste en ofrecer productos de uso personal tales como camisetas tricotextil, camisas de caballero, bóxer de damas y caballeros, trajes de niños y niñas, tobilleras, blusas variadas, calsetas de caballeros, perfumes para dama y caballeros, golosinas y gaseosas, granos básicos entre otros. Desde hace 6 años tiene su negocio,  reside en el municipio de Pio XII, departamento de Masaya donde también tiene su puesto de venta. Su núcleo familiar es de cuatro personas, vive en condiciones cómoda

Con este crédito que solicita con Ceprodel es su séptimo préstamo, el cual le ha servido de gran ayuda porque ha engrandecido su negocio, este lo quiere para seguir invertirtiendole mas en productos que siente le son muy demandados por sus clientes.
texts.en:
Doña Yadira, 49, is married and owns a small business selling personal items such as knit t-shirts, men's shirts, boxer shorts, children's clothing, blouses, men's socks, men's and women's perfumes, sweets, sodas, and basic grains among other items.  She has been in business for six years.  She lives in the town of Pio XII, in the department of Masaya where she also has her food stall.  Her family of four lives in comfortable surroundings.

This will be her seventh loan through Ceprodel, which has been of great help to her in expanding her business. The loan is to continue investing in more of the products she considers to be most popular.

loans.use: To buy knit t-shirts, boxer shorts, men's shirts, children's clothing, blouses, socks, men's and women's perfumes, sweets and sodas.

loans.name: Erdenechimeg

texts.en: Erdenechimeg is a 40-year-old woman who lives with her husband and three children in Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Her husband is employed. Her younger children study at the secondary school and college. She started a garment retail business in 2008 at a rent counter. Her business activities are stable now, and she is planning to increase her volume. Erdenechimeg is a hard-working and active woman who says, "I would like to develop my business activities by purchasing garment supplies in large quantities. I have a plan to expand my business." The total amount she is requesting is 1,500,000 MNT to buy garment supplies.

loans.use: To buy garment supplies

loans.name: Dieu Agit Group

texts.fr:
Mme FATOUMATA est la responsable du groupe  DIEU AGIT. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Le plus âgé a 07 ans et le moins âgé a 09 mois. 02 vont à l’école et elle a 05 personnes en charge.

Mme est gérante d’une boutique depuis 07ans. Elle s’approvisionne  chez  les grossistes à Sankarayaré. Ses clients sont les amis et voisin du quartier.

Elle veut s’acheter 01 bidon d’huile; 01 sac de sucre; 01 sac de riz ; 01 carton de savon  et 01 paquet de bonbon et 01 paquet de biscuit. 

Mme épargne ses économies  pour aider à la scolarisation des enfants. Elle ambitionne  agrandir sa  boutique.
texts.en:
Fatoumata is in charge of the Dieu Agit group. She is married and mother to three children. The eldest is seven years old and the youngest nine months. Two of her children go to school and she has five dependents. 

Fatoumata has been a shop manager for the past seven years. Se gets her supplies from wholesalers in Sankarayaré. Her customers are friends and neighbors from the neighborhood. 

She wants to buy one container of oil, one sack of sugar, one sack of rice, one carton of soaps, one package of candies and one package of biscuits. 

She is saving money for her children's education and her ambition is to expand her shop.

loans.use: to buy one container of oil, one sack of sugar, one sack of rice, one carton of soaps, one package of candies and one package of biscuits.

loans.name: Jeronima

texts.es:
La socia Jeronima nació en el departamento de Huancavelica pero actualmente vive en la ciudad de Anta. Jeronima tiene 54 años de edad y es casada y fruto de esa unión tiene cinco hijos. Su actividad económica de la socia Jeronima es la ganadería entonces ella se dedica  a la crianza de animales menores compra cuyes y gallinas, ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar animales menores como gallinas. 

La socia Jeronima pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen Inmaculada Concepción de Anta” de la Asociación Arariwa de la provincia del Cusco.
texts.en:
Jeronima was born in the department of Huancavelica but now she lives in the city of Anta. Jeronima is 54 years old and is married and from that marriage has five children. Jeronima's economic activity is raising animals. She raises small animals, buying guinea pigs and chickens. Right now she needs the loan to buy some chickens.

Jeronima belongs to the “Virgen Inmaculada Concepción de Anta” communal bank of the Asociación Arariwa in the province of Cuzco.

loans.use: to buy small animals such as hens.

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.en:
Leonarda is 35 years old and married.

She works hard to provide for her family and runs a general store in the Philippines. Leonarda has requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Leonarda has borrowed and paid back three previous loans from NWTF. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Leonarda aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Turab

texts.en:
Turab is a 22-year-old man, who is very friendly. He is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) and lives with his parents in the Bilasuavr IDP Settlement. He is a farmer and has grown seasonal fruits and vegetables for the last two years. Turab was unemployed and did not have any educational qualifications. When he got married, he needed a source of income to support his new family and he started his business. 

Over the last two years Turab has gained enough skills and experience  to run the business, thanks to his father`s experience. He chose this crop business because it is profitable and fresh fruits and vegetables are in high demand. 

People use fresh vegetables everyday and consider them healthy; many national dishes are made from vegetables, like pilau and dolma. Fresh fruits appear on every family table in Azerbaijan and are also used to make fresh punch. He usually sells his crop in the central bazaar. His monthly income is 60 AZN.

As these products are in high demand, Turab wants to expand his business and produce more fruits and vegetables to meet market demand and to increase his monthly income. 

For this purpose he has applied for 1000 AZN. He will buy new garden tools, seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy new garden tools, seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Rza

texts.en:
Rza is a 44-year-old man. He is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person), who lives in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement with his wife and two sons. 

He is a farmer and has grown seasonal fruits and vegetables for the last 18 years. He chose this business because it is profitable and fresh crops are in high demand. People use fresh vegetables everyday and consider them healthy; many national dishes are made from vegetables, like pilau and dolma. Fresh fruits are served on every family table in Azerbaijan and are also used to make fresh punch.

Rza sells his crops in the Bilasuvar central bazaar. His monthly income is 80 AZN. His wife actively helps him to grow crops.

As these products are in high demand, Rza wants to expand his business and produce more fruits and vegetables to meet market demand. For this purpose has he applied for 1,500 AZN. 

He will buy new garden tools, seeds and fertilizers. This will be his fourth loan and he has a positive loan history.

loans.use: to buy new garden tools, seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Lourlyn

texts.en:
Lourlyn is 42 years old and married with two children.

Lourlyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell.

Lourlyn has borrowed and paid back six previous loans from NWTF. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Lourlyn aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell

loans.name: Rouguiètou

texts.fr:
Madame Rouguiètou est une habituée de la caisse ; elle est à son 4ème crédit. C’est une commerçante qui s’active depuis près de 10 ans déjà.  Elle est célibataire sans enfant et vit avec ses parents. Elle est âgée de 36 ans. Son commerce consiste à vendre des chaussures sur commande. Actuellement, avec  le prêt, elle  veut  payer des frais pour la fabrication de chaussures qu’on lui a commandées déjà.
Elle s’occupe des frais d’électricité et d’eau ; mais aussi de ses dépenses personnelles.
Elle désire diversifier ses produits et services dans l’avenir et augmenter son fond de roulement avec l’appui des préteurs.
texts.en:
Rouguiètou is a regular customer of the branch and is on her fourth loan. She been working as a trader for almost ten years. She is single and has no children and she lives with her parents. She is 36 years old. Her business is selling shoes to order. 

With the current loan she wants to pay for the costs of making the shoes that have already been ordered from her. She takes care of the electricity and water costs but also her own personal expenses. She would like to diversify her products and services in the future and also increase her working capital with help from lenders.

loans.use: to buy shoes for resale

loans.name: Alain

texts.fr: Alain est un jeune homme de 37 ans, marié père d'un enfant agé de 2 ans. Il a pour activité l'agriculture (cultures vivrière) qu'il exerce depuis 10 ans. Il a une longue expérience dans ce domaine et une clientèle fidèle déjà. il aimerai faire de plus grands espaces pour celà, il lui faudra plus d'engrais et de semance. ce qui lui permettra d'augmenter ses bénéfice et subvenir aux besoins de sa petite famille.
texts.en: Alain is 37 years old, married and the father of a 2-year-old child. He has been farming food crops for 10 years. He has a great deal of experience in this area and already has a loyal clientele. He would like to expand his activities and needs more fertilizer and seeds; this will enable him to increase his profits and meet his small family's needs.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and invest further in his agricultural business.

loans.name: Patrice

texts.fr: Patrice est un jeune homme de 27 ans célibataire sans enfant. il commenrçant à l'étalage dans un marché de la place où il vends  des chaussures. Ilsollicite ce crédit pour agrandir sa structure  en ayant un comptoir et plus de marchandises, ce qui lui permettra d'éviter certains intempéries climatiques auxquels il est souvent exposer, de réaliser un plus bénéfices et de s'affirmer dans la vie active.
texts.en: Patrice is a young, 27-year-old man. He is single and has no children. He sells shoes that he displays at the local market. He is requesting this loan so that he can expand his current setup with a counter and more stock; this would enable him to avoid certain adverse weather conditions which he is often exposed to, to improve his profits and to build a good professional reputation.

loans.use: to build a counter and restock on merchandise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw materials and piglets.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 43 years old and married with six children.

Editha works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying and selling rice in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 35,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

Editha has borrowed and paid 30 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the business of buying and selling rice for 20 years. She also earns an income from selling ready-to-wear clothes.

Editha aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie works hard to support her family. Julie is married and has a restaurant business in the Philippines.

Julie has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food-production business.

Julie has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Julie would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her food-production business.

loans.name: Dionisia

texts.en:
Dionisia is 61 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by pig-fattening in the Philippines. Dionisia is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Dionisia has been pig-fattening for two years. She also earns additional income from fish-vending.

Dionisia is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream -- to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 53 years old and married with two children.

Alma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her store.

Alma has borrowed and paid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane.

Alma aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell in her store.

loans.name: Allahverdi

texts.en:
Allahverdi is a 68-year-old man on a pension. He is married with three children. He lives with his family in Bilasuvar. He breeds cows and sells milk, milk products and cattle for meat purposes to local butchers. Allahverdi has more than 20 years of experience in this field, thanks to his father who taught him how best to look after cattle.

Allahverdi usually buys young cows, and then raises and fattens them. Within five to six months, he resells them for profit in the local livestock bazaar.  He also sells milk and yogurt to his neighbors. Through milk and meat selling, he earns 300 AZN per month. Milk, yogurt and meat are very popular products in Azerbaijan. People use meat in everyday national dishes such as pilau and dolma. Milk products are considered very healthy and are also present in everyday life.   

There is only one income in his family, which is not enough to cover the basic needs of his beloved children. Allahverdi has applied for 1,000 AZN to purchase one milk cow and fodder. This will be his second loan from AqroInvest. Allahverdi has a good client history.

loans.use: to buy one milk cow and fodder.

loans.name: Latif 2 Group

texts.fr:
Mme FELECITE est la responsable du groupe  LATIF 2. Elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants. Le plus âgé a 22 ans et le moins âgé a 03 ans. 03vont à l’école et elle a 06 personnes en charge.

Mme est gérante d’une boutique depuis 01an. Elle s’approvisionne  chez  les grossistes à Sondogo. Ses clients sont les amis et voisin du quartier.

Elle veut s’acheter 02 bidons d’huile; 01 sac de sucre; 01 sac de savon  et 01 plat de gombo sec. 

Mme épargne ses économies  pour acheter une moto pour son  1er enfant. Elle ambitionne  ouvrir une grande boutique.
texts.en:
Mrs. FELECITE is the leader of the group LATIF 2. She is a married mother of four children aged 3 to 22, three of whom go to school. She has six dependents in her care. 

Mrs. Felecite has been running a food store for the past year. She buys her merchandise from wholesalers in Sondogo. Her customers are friends and neighbors. 

She plans to buy two jugs of oil, one bag of sugar, one bag of soap, and one plate of dry gumbo.  

She is saving to buy a motorcycle for her eldest child. In the future, she plans to open a large store.

loans.use: to buy 2 jugs of oil, one bag of sugar, one bag of soap, and one plate of dry gumbo.

loans.name: Mont Sinaï Group

texts.fr:
Mme FATI est la responsable du groupe  MONT SINAÏ. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Le plus âgé a 14 ans et le moins âgé a 04 ans.02 vont à l’école et elle a 05 personnes en charge.

Mme vend de la bouillie et du gari (farine de manioc) depuis 07ans. Elle s’approvisionne à Lomé au TOGO. Ses clients sont les amis et voisins.

Elle veut s’acheter 02 sacs de 100 kg de gari ; 01 sac de mil ; ½ sac du sucre ; ½ chargement  d’un camion de bois.
 
Mme utilise ses économies  pour aider à la scolarisation des enfants et ambitionne  agrandir son activité.
texts.en:
Mrs. FATI is the leader of the group MONT SINAÏ. She is a married mother of three children aged 4 to 14, two of whom go to school. She has five dependents in her care. 

Mrs. Fati has been selling porridge and cassava flour for seven years. She buys her supplies in the city of Lomé, in TOGO. Her customers are friends and neighbors. 

She plans to buy two 100 kg bags of cassava flour, one bag of millet, half a bag of sugar, and half a truckload of wood. 

She uses her savings to support her children`s education. In the future, she plans to expand her business activity.

loans.use: to buy two 100 kg bags of cassava flour, one bag of millet, half a bag of sugar, and half a truckload of wood.

loans.name: Ginelba

texts.es:
Ginelba, es casada y tiene un hijo, ella estudio solo hasta la secundaria y actualmente se dedica a la venta de edredones por muchas horas y de forma ambulante ya que no tiene un puesto fijo. Su esposo no tiene muchos ingresos por que trabaja como chofer de transporte Urbano en la ciudad de La Paz, Es por la misma razón que ambos aportan con los gastos alimenticios y servicios básicos de su familia.
El crédito lo requiere para aumentar su mercadería (comprar más edredones – que son pequeñas colchas que sirven para taparse en la cama) y generar mas ingresos para mantener a su familia ya que su hijo esta en etapa escolar y tampoco  cuentan con seguro medico.
El sueño que tiene Ginelba es tener una casa propia para dar más comodidad a su familia ya que ahora viven en la casa de sus padres y solo ocupan dos dormitorios que son de adobe y el piso de tierra, la misma se encuentra ubicada  en la zona Obispo Bosque de la ciudad de La Paz.
Es la novena vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y la septima vez junto a KIVA.
La gente comerciante como Ginelba, cambia de rubro constantemente pues ve la oportunidad de hacer más dinero vendiendo otros productos para el público.
texts.en:
Ginelba is married and has one child. She only has a high school education, so she now spends many hours selling bedspreads as a street vendor since she does not have an established location. Her husband does not earn much income since he works as a bus driver in the city of La Paz. For this reason, they help each other with the family expenses, such as food and basic utilities. The loan she is requesting will be used to increase her inventory of bedspreads (small blankets that serve as bed coverings). This will help her generate more income to support her family, especially her son who is of school age. Her family also does not have health insurance.

Ginelba dreams of having a house of her own so that she can provide more comfort for her family. She currently lives at her parents' house and her family occupies two rooms that are made of adobe and have dirt floors. Their home is located in the District of Obispo Bosque in the city of La Paz.

This is the ninth time she has worked with IMPRO and the seventh with Kiva. Merchants, such as Ginelba, change businesses constantly whenever they find opportunities to earn more money selling different products to the public.

loans.use: to purchase bedspreads to sell.

loans.name: Parkhat

texts.ru:
Пархат 40 лет, замужем, имеет 4 детей. Пархат работает преподавателем в местной школе села Бужум и в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи - на протяжении 30 лет занимается животноводством. Начатый с суммы в 5,000 сом (KGS) бизнес, благодаря упорному труду Пархат,  приносит около 15,000 сом с продажи молока и молочных продуктов. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Пархат обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку скота - молодняка.  Доходы от кредита Пархат планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение домашней скотины.
texts.en:
Parkhat is forty years old, married and she has four children. Parhat works as a teacher in a local school, but in order to supplement her income she's bred and raised animals for the past thirty years. Her business, started from a sum of 5,000 soms, now provides her with a monthly income of around 15,000 soms, generated by the sale of milk and milk products. 
With the goal of expanding her business, Parkhat approached "Bai Tushum and Partners" with a request for 100,000 soms (KGS) in order to purchase some young livestock. She plans to reinvest money gained from the loan back into her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Aynura

texts.ru:
Aynura zamujem i imeyet 3 detey. Ona yavlyayetsya IDP personom, pereselenec iz Fuzuli goroda kotoriy yavlyayetsya okkupirovannimi territoriyami. Aynura seychas jivet v Fizuli regione vmeste so svoyey semyoy. Aynura 31 let.
3 goda nazad ona nachala zanimatsya pticevodstvom i razvodit kuric. Seychas ona nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit kuricci dlya razvitiya svoyego biznessa i uvelicheniya kolichestva kuricc. Aynura etomu biznessu nauchilas u svoyey teti.
texts.en:
Aynura is married and has three children. She's an internally displaced person (IDP) and had to move from the city of Fuzuli which is now considered occupied territory. Today, Aynura lives in the Fuzuli region with her family. She's thirty-one years old. Three years ago she began a business focused on raising chickens. 
She's asking for a loan of 2000 AZN in order to purchase some chickens to expand her business and increase her chicken count. She learned this trade from her aunt.

loans.use: to purchase chickens.

loans.name: Florinda Agustina

texts.es:
La señora Florinda Agustina es casada, tiene 37 años de edad, cursó los grados de educación primaria, tiene 3 hijos los cuales están estudiando, se dedica a la confección de delantales, inició gracias al apoyo de un familiar, lleva 16 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo.

Solicita un prestamos para la compra de telas típicas para elabora delantales y también la compra de hilos de diferente colores. Espera en el futuro seguir agrandando su negocio.
texts.en:
Florinda Agustina is married, 37 years old, and completed primary school. She has three children all of whom are studying. She makes a living making aprons and began this thanks to the support of a family member. She has 16 years of experience and the support of her husband.

She is requesting a loan to buy traditional fabrics to make aprons and also to buy threads of different colors. In the future she hopes to continue growing her business.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and threads.

loans.name: Francisco Jesus

texts.es:
Francisco es un joven de 22 años de edad, junto a el vive su madre y su pequeña hermana, a quienes apoya mucho con el fruto de su trabajo ya que lamentablemente desde pequeños su padre los abandono  y desde ese entones el tuvo la iniciativa de apoyar a su madre y a su hermana, su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Pisco, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido y acogedor, asimismo en él se encuentra las “Islas Ballestas”, quien recibe infinidad de turistas en todo el año. Francisco trabaja como chofer de mototaxi, anteriormente trabajaba en un vehículo alquilado pero después de mucho esfuerzo, ahorros y sobre todo un poco de apoyo de parte de su familia, logro tener su mototaxi propia, en la cual trabaja alrededor d 10 horas al día;  lleva ya 3 años trabajando y el cree que le  va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable con los clientes y sobre todo que lo hace con muchas ganas de salir adelante y ello hace que en el día le vaya bien.

Francisco está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar herramientas para realizar el mantenimiento de su vehículo, así el podrá tener las herramientas necesarias para cualquier inconveniente y dará mas seguridad a los clientes, lo que le permitirá seguir trabajando para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y estudiar una carrera universitaria”.
texts.en:
Francisco is a young man of 22.  He lives together with his mother and his little sister who he supports a lot through his work.  Sadly, their father abandoned them when they were very young.  Since then, Francisco has taken the initiative of supporting his mother and sister.  Their home is located in the city of Pisco.  This is a city which is noted for its warm and welcoming climate.  It is also home to the 'Ballestas Islands' which receive a large number of tourists year round.

Francisco is a motorcycle taxi driver.  He used to work in a rented vehicle but with a lot of effort, savings and, above all, a little bit of support from his family, he managed to acquire his own motorcycle taxi.  He works around 10 hours a day in his vehicle.  He has been working for three years and believes that his business is doing well because he is very kind to his customers and, above all, he works with a great desire to get ahead in life.  This has meant that things are going well.

Francisco is very grateful to Kiva lenders because, thanks to the help that they have offered, he will be able to buy tools with which to maintain his vehicle.  This will enable him to have the tools he needs to deal with any problem and he will be able to offer his customers a safer journey.  He will be able to continue working towards fulfilling his biggest dream: to provide his family with a better quality of life and to study for a university degree.

loans.use: to buy tools

loans.name: Ousmane

texts.fr: Ousmane est un homme marié qui exerce trois  activités: lr transport, le commerce de vêtement et l'embouche bovine.Il conduit un taxi de transport urbain depuis 2005.En même temps , il achète périodiquement un bœuf qu'il engraisse durant quelques mois avant de le revendre. Il a une cantine de vente d'habits tenue par une de ses sœurs.Cette diversité d'activités lui assure des revenus assez intéressants qui lui permettent de prendre en charge les dépenses d'entretien de la famille.Afin de, renforcer son fonds de commerce, il sollicite un pret de 300000f pour acheter des pantalons, des chemises, des tissus et d'autres articles divers. Il ambitionne de se lancer dans le maraîchage.
texts.en:
Ousmane is a married man who practices three business activities: transportation, clothing sales, and cattle fattening. He has been driving a city taxi since 2005. As a secondary activity, he occasionally buys an ox which he fattens over a few months for resale. He also has a small clothing store run by one of his sisters. With such diverse activities, he is able to earn substantial income that allows him to provide for his family’s needs. 

To strengthen his working capital, he is seeking a loan of 300,000F to buy trousers, shirts, fabrics and various other items. In the future, he plans to launch a market gardening activity.

loans.use: to buy trousers, shirts, fabrics and various other items.

loans.name: Sari Karya Group

texts.en:
This is the fifth loan to the Sari Karya group. They still need financial support until they are able to continue business with their own capital. With every sale of pork, they are saving the profits to use as venture capital. 

Ni Ketut is using the new loan to buy two piglets. She plans to sell the piglets for pork roll. This requires easier care than for superior pigs and provides faster sales. She hopes her new plan can be more successful.

loans.use: To buy two piglets.

loans.name: Vidadi

texts.en:
Vidadi is a 39-year-old man who is married and has four children. He is IDP (an internally displaced person) and lives in the Bilasuvar IDP settlement. Vidadi has bred cattle and cows for the last eight years. He works as school teacher and his salary is 120 AZN, which is too low to cover family needs. 

Vidadi usually buys small calves, raises and fattens them for five or six months and then resells for a more profitable price in the livestock bazaar. His monthly income is 200 AZN and this business is the main source of financial income in his family. Beef is in very high demand in Azerbaijan and people use it in everyday dishes like pilau and dolma. Vidadi also keeps milk cows for personal use and for selling to neighbors. 
 
He wants to expand his business and improve the living conditions of his family. He applied for a 1,400 AZN loan to purchase one milk cow, two cattle and fodder. This will be his third loan from AqroInvest CU and he has a good client history.

loans.use: to buy one milk cow, two cattle and fodder.

loans.name: Suleyman

texts.en:
Suleyman is a very friendly and hardworking man of 22 years old. He is single and lives with his parents. He is IDP and lives with his family in the Bilasuvar IDP settlement.   

He breeds cows and cattle and sells milk and milk products as well as cattle for meat purposes to local butchers. Suleyman has already two years of experience, but from childhood he has been observing his father and helping him to look after livestock. 

Suleyman usually buys calves, raises and fattens them in five or six months and resells them for a more profitable price in the local livestock bazaar. He also sells milk and yoghurt to the neighbors. 

Milk and meat selling brings in 100 AZN in income per month. Milk and yoghurt, as well as meat are very popular products in Azerbaijan. People use meat in everyday national dishes as pilau and dolma and always use yoghurt sauce. Milk products are considered very healthful and also present in everyday life.   

Suleyman applied for 1,000 AZN to purchase one milk cow and one other cow.

loans.use: to buy one milk cow and one other cow.

loans.name: Narantsetseg

texts.en:
Narantsetseg is 41 years old, married, and has two children.  She lives in Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia's capital. Her family lives in a ger, a traditional nomadic tent, in the city's outer district. Her husband works as a guard in a local shop.

Narantsetseg supports her family by running a shop that sells books and magazines in the town's largest indoor market. When she first began her business in 2003, she had 2,000,000 tugriks (MNT) in working capital. Now she has 10,700,000 MNT and sells pre-paid phone cards as well as books, magazines, and newspapers. 

Narantsetseg is requesting her third loan from Transcapital Co. Ltd. for 3,500,000 MNT, which she will use to buy more items to sell to her customers. Her goal for next year is to improve her business by expanding her stall and increasing her working capital, which will help her attract more customers.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her bookstore.

loans.name: Marco Erminio

texts.es:
El señor  marco Herminio vive en la ciudad de Managua trabaja como comerciante  en un mercado de Managua  el negocio del señor es venta de anteojos para el sol y venta de relojes.
 El señor marco  solicito el crédito para hacer las mejoras en su vivienda y haci mejorar las condiciones de vida  de su familia , y manifiesta que se siente agradecido con ceprodel porque gracias a los crédito que ha hecho en ceprodel   ha podido  crecer en  su negocio, y mejorar su vivienda por que con los prestamos obtenido el 50% es para su negocio y el 50% para  mejorar su vivienda para proporcionarles un techo digno a su familia
texts.en:
Marco Herminio lives in the city of Managua and works as a shopkeeper in a market in Managua. His business is selling sunglasses and watches.

Marco is requesting the loan to make improvements on his home and thus improve his family's living conditions. He expresses that he feels grateful for Ceprodel because thanks to the loan that they've given him he has been able to grow his business and improve his home. 50% of the loan is for his business and 50% is to improve his home in order to provide his family with a decent roof over their heads.

loans.use: to buy zinc, purlines, and merchandise.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La socia Juana nació en la ciudad de Anta y vive en la ciuda donde nació. Juana tiene 45 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hijos. Su actividad económica principal de la socia Juana es la venta de ropa y ella también se dedica  a la crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes y gallinas, ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar ropa. 

La socia Juana pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen Inmaculada Concepción de Anta” de la Asociación Arariwa de la provincia del Cusco.
texts.en:
Juana was born in the city of Anta and she lives in the city in which she was born.  She is 45 years old and lives with her common-law husband.  The couple have four children.  Juana's main business activity is selling clothing.  She also raises animals such as guinea pigs and hens.  On this occasion, she needs a loan to buy clothing.

Juana is a member of Asociación Arariwa's "Virgen Inmaculada Concepción de Anta" community bank in Cusco province.

loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase two tailoring machines and a generator.

loans.name: Amparo Del Socorro

texts.es:
Doña Amparo, reside en el departamento de Masaya, casada, comerciante, tiene la edad de 51 años, ella posee su negocio desde hace 9 años, el cual  consiste en vender productos de alimentos elaborados por ella, tiene el apoyo de su esposo en cual entre los dos se apoyan para mantener en pie siempre su negocio. 

Su puesto de trabajo ubicado de Nindirí, del cual la mayoría de sus clientes pertenecen ahí, por lo que nunca deja de vender sus productos y siempre están en movimiento,  se acerca a nuestra oficina para solicitar un nuevo préstamo para reabastecer con más productos su negocio. Y dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Amparo lives in Masaya. She is married and is a merchant. She is 51 years old. She has had her business for nine years. She sells food products made by her. She receives support from her husband. They support each other in order to always keep the business going. 

Her business is located in Nindirí. The majority of her customers are from there. She never stops selling her products and she’s always moving around. She came to our office to request a new loan in order to replenish her business with more products, so she can give her customers better service.

loans.use: purchase chicken, pork, soft drinks, candy, juices, fruit, etc.

loans.name: Hipolita

texts.es:
La socia Hipolita nació en la ciudad de Anta y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació. Su actividad económica principal de la socia Hipolita es la venta de productos secos y ella también se dedica a la venta de verduras y venta de productos de primera necesidad, ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar productos de primera necesidad como por ejemplo sacos de arroz, sacos de azúcar y productos secos como por ejemplo trigo, cebada y otros. 

La socia Hipolita pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen Inmaculada Concepción de Anta” de la Asociación Arariwa de la provincia del Cusco.
texts.en:
Hipolita was born in the city of Anta and lives in the city in which she was born.  Her main business activity is selling dried products.  She also sells vegetables and basic household products.  On this occasion, she needs a loan to buy basic household products such as, for example, sacks of rice and sugar, and dried products such as wheat, barley, etc.

Hipolita is a member of Asociación Arariwa's "Virgen Inmaculada Concepción de Anta" community bank in Cusco province.

loans.use: to buy basic household products such as sacks of rice and sugar, and dried products such as wheat, barley, etc.

loans.name: Moureen

texts.en:
Moureen is 21 years old and married to Wycliffe, and together they have one child.

She has been keeping poultry as her primary activity in Nakuru town for the last one year. She sells the chickens to the open air market and hotels, and she supplies the eggs to various retailers.
 
This will be her first loan from KADET Ltd., and she plans to use the loan to buy more stock of poultry, especially chicks -- that is, layers and broilers -- for rearing.

In the future, Moureen hopes to become a poultry supplier to various hotels and consumers in Nakuru town.

loans.use: to add more stock of poultry, especially chicks, for rearing.

loans.name: Samya

texts.en:
Samya is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband, Hassan, appears in her Kiva profile photo.

Samya is a 32-year-old woman.She is married to Hassan and a mother to two sons and one daughter. Her husband is employed but gets a low salary that is not enough to cover the costs of the family's needs.

Samya is requesting a 1,500 USD loan from FATEN to help her cover the cost of purchasing the requested paints and painting the family's house, which consists of three rooms, one kitchen and two bathrooms. This will enable Samya and her family to enjoy living in an improved house.

loans.use: To paint the family's house.

loans.name: Sattar

texts.en:
Sattar is from Iraq. He is 45 years old, married and has four children.

Sattar has owned a food market since 2008, selling soft drinks, juices, groceries, cheese, frozen beef, chicken, fish, and dairy products. He has sufficient experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knowledge of their needs. He has a good reputation and he is well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting a $2,400 loan to pay the annual rent. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent.

loans.name: Livington Armando

texts.es: Livington es un padre de familia que vive en Santa Elena. Es graduado de Lic en Educación pero a sus 34 años no ejerce su profesión ya que su negocio le genera mayor rentabilidad. Es maestro de ebanistería realiza muebles de sala, comedor, camas, también se dedica a la crianza de pollos. Le preguntamos como así también cría pollos y nos comenta que siempre le ha gustado pero que los tenía en un terreno de su propiedad en las Garzas (recinto cerca de Libertad) como no tenia quien los cuidara los trajo a su casa ahora quien les dedica tiempo es su esposa. En el negocio de ebanistería le ayuda un sobrino laborando de lunes a domingo sin horario establecido. Con mucho orgullo Livington nos cuenta que su esposa es muy trabajadora ya que vende ropa y productos por catálogos. Tiene dos hijos que están en la escuela fiscal. El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de pollos para la crianza, madera para la creación de muebles. En un futuro le gustaría hacer un galpón para la crianza de sus animales y así ampliar su producción.
texts.en: Livington is a father who lives in Santa Elena.  He has a degree in Education but, at 34 years old, he does not work in his profession because his business is more profitable.  He is a cabinet maker who makes living room, dining room and bedroom furniture.  He also raises chickens.  We ask him how come he also raises chickens and he tells us that he has always liked the business but he used to keep his chickens on a plot of land that he owned in Las Garzas (which is near Libertad).  As he didn't have anybody to care for them, he brought them to his house and now it is his wife who spends time caring for them.  In his cabinetry business, he has the help of a nephew.  They work from Monday to Sunday but do not work fixed hours.  Livington tells us very proudly that his wife is very hard-working because she sells clothing and other products through catalogs.  Livington has two children who are attending a state school.  He will invest his loan in buying chickens to raise and also wood for making furniture.  In the future, he would like to build a shed in which to raise his animals so that he can increase his production.

loans.use: to buy chickens

loans.name: Naziran's Group

texts.en:
Naziran is a 44-year-old married woman, and by this relationship she has three children: two sons and one daughter. Her sons are involved in a loading business. They have donkey carts that they used to deliver goods to designated places. Her daughter is free, stays at home and manages the household work with Naziran.
 
Naziran and her husband both are very hardworking persons and they own and operate a dairy business. Their work is home-based. They have a buffalo from which they get milk that they sell to customers. In this way, they generate income for the family.
 
Naziran has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her dairy business. She will invest the loan in buying another buffalo for increasing the milk quantity and the sales. 

Naziran and her husband are very confident about the positive financial growth of their business.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo for the dairy business.

loans.name: Mahdi

texts.en:
Mahdi is from Iraq. He is 42 years old, married and has four children.

Mahdi has owned a coffee shop since 2009, offering different types of hot and cold drinks.

He has good experience in this field, a deep understanding of customers, and knowledge about their needs. He has a good reputation and he is well known in his area.

He applied for a $2,400 loan in order to pay the annual rent for his shop. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for his shop.

loans.name: Tofiq

texts.en:
Tofiq is 52 years old and a very kind and friendly man. He is married and has one son. He has been raising sheep for the last ten years. He sells them for mutton, which is very popular among local people. Many popular dishes like dolma and pilov are made of mutton. People consider it to be very healthy and digestible.

Tofiq usually buys small lambs, raises and fattens them, and sells them for a profitable price. His monthly income is 200 AZN and this is the only income in his family. Keeping the family and covering the needs of his child is a very hard job. 

Also, looking after animals is much harder and requires spending a lot of time outside. The climate in the region is harsh, but Tofiq is a very positive man and hopes to earn enough to provide a better life for his beloved child.

He applied for a 1,200 AZN loan in order to purchase fifteen sheep to cover his market demand. As summer is very close, it is a good time to fatten lambs and sell them for profitable prices for wedding parties, of which there are a lot during this season. This will be Tofiq’s second loan and he has a positive client history.

loans.use: to buy fifteen sheep.

loans.name: Zacharia

texts.en:
Zacharia has owned a posho mill (maize flour mill) business in Olkalou town for the last two years. He also sells dried maize to his customers. He is 38 years old, married to Esther and they have three children.

He plans to use this loan to connect electricity to his posho mill business and thereby be able to serve his customers better. This will also enable him to make more income.

In the future, he hopes to expand his business and set up another posho mill to serve the many maize farmers who need the service.

loans.use: to connect electricity to his flour mill business

loans.name: Baba

texts.en: Baba, 22, is proudly pursuing his university degree.  His study years are from 2008 to 2012 in the faculty of Mathematics and Physics at Agjabadi Teacher`s University.  His mother, father and brother are working, and his father pays his tuition fee. Baba wishes to complete his education and start working as a school teacher and so is requesting a loan for 1200 AZN to pay his final year of education.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 41 years old, single, and has one child.  She sells jumpers and jackets for both children and adults, which she has been doing for 10 years.

Esther is requesting her first loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to buy more jackets, sweaters, and jumpers. This being a cold season, the demand has been high and the loan will enable her to meet her customers' needs and demands.  In the future, Esther hopes to expand her business,  open a boutique, and earn more income, and thereby provide a good education for her child.

loans.use: to purchase more jackets, sweaters, and jumpers.

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr:
Madame Fatou est une couturière de formation. Elle est veuve et mère de famille. Elle est âgée de  43 ans. Elle est à son 1èr crédit, qui va lui permettre d’acheter du fil et des tissus, avec quoi elle va confectionner  des ensembles pour les revendre. Sa marchandise est très demandée dans le voisinage, c’est pourquoi elle a besoin de l’aide de l’IMCEC pour satisfaire la demande. 
Madame Fatou n’a pas de charges qui l’encombrent et elle travaille pour diversifier ses produits et services. Dans l’avenir elle aimerait augmenter son capital pour mieux satisfaire la demande qui est existante.
texts.en:
Mrs. Fatou is a seamstress by trade. She is a 43-year-old widow with children. 

This first loan will allow her to buy thread and fabrics to make clothing for sale. With her merchandise in high demand in her neighborhood, she needs financial assistance from IMCEC to satisfy her customers. 

Mrs. Fatou doesn’t have any debts. She strives to diversify her products and services. In the future, she would like to increase her working capital to better meet customer demand.

loans.use: to buy thread and fabrics to make clothes for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise (pants, shirts, polo shirts, blouses, and others).

loans.name: Meriy

texts.es:
La socia nació en la ciudad del Cusco pero vive en ciudad de Anta en la provincia del Cusco, ella tiene 26 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre  de la cual tiene un hijo. Su actividad económica principal es la crianza de animales menores como cuyes y gallinas, ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más animales menores como cuyes y gallinas.     
  
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen Inmaculada Concepción de Anta” de la Asociación Arariwa de la provincia del Cusco.
texts.en:
Meriy was born in the city of Cusco, and she now lives in the city of Anta, in the province of Cusco. She is 26 years old, and has a son with her partner. She makes a living raising small animals, such as guinea pigs and chickens, and is requesting this loan in order to purchase more guinea pigs and chickens.

She belongs to the community bank, “Virgen Inmaculada Concepción de Anta” (Virgin of the Immaculate Conception of Anta), which is part of the Arariwa Association in the province of Cusco.

loans.use: to purchase small animals, such as guinea pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Abdoulaye

texts.fr: Abdoulaye est un mécanicien.Il est célibataire mais a à sa charge ses frères et sœurs depuis le décès de son père.Il exerce ce métier depuis près de dix ans.Aujourd'hui, il sollicite un prêt de 250000f pour acheter un moteur neuf pour son véhicule.Son ambition est de terminer sa maison et de construire un grand magasin de vente de pièces détachées en centre ville.
texts.en:
Abdoulaye is a mechanic. He is single but has had siblings in his care since the death of their father. He has been practicing his profession for nearly ten years.

He is seeking a loan of 250,000F to buy a new engine for his vehicle. His goal is to finish work on his house and build a large store downtown to sell spare parts.

loans.use: to buy a new engine.

loans.name: Neftalí Guillermo

texts.es: La familia de Neftali se ha dedicado desde hace varias generaciones al cultivo del café y fue su abuelo quien le enseñó lo necesario y le heredó una parcela para que pudiera llevar a cabo esta actividad. Además de entregar su producción a la “Unión Regional de Huatusco” Neftalí  procesa parte de esta pues cuenta con su propia marca de café la cual distribuye en comercios de la localidad en la que vive. Este es un negocio familiar en el que lo ayudan su esposa y su hijo, a quienes ha inculcado el amor por el café. Durante la última cosecha tuvo una producción de 4 toneladas y él quiere aumentar su producción. Para eso necesita comprar planta de café pues actualmente tiene un total de 3800 plantas y va a comprar 1200 para tener un total de 5000. Por esta razón necesita de un crédito. Entre los proyectos futuros que tiene Neftalí están el de construir una casa, pues ya cuenta con un terreno y también más adelante desea que su hijo pueda estudiar una carrera universitaria para tener más oportunidades en el mundo laboral.
texts.en: Neftali's family has worked at cultivating coffee for many generations and it was his grandfather who taught him all that is necessary and he inherited a parcel of land so that he would be able to carry out this work.  In addition to delivering his production to the “Unión Regional de Huatusco” (Huatusco Regional Union), Neftalí processes part of his crop since he has his own brand of coffee which he distributes in local stores where he lives.  This is a family business, and he is helped by his wife and son, to whom he has instilled the love of coffee.  During the last harvest, he had a production of 4 tons and he would like to increase his production.  For this, he needs to purchase more coffee plants.  Currently, he has a total of 3800 plants and he is going to purchase 1200 so he will have a total of 5000.  For this reason, he needs a loan.  Among Neftalí's future projects, is that of building a house as he already has the land and later on, he also desires for his son to be able to study a university career so that he will have more opportunities in the world of labor.

loans.use: to purchase coffee plants for his coffee plantation.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth makes a living by running a tailoring business in the town of Nakuru town. She is 33 years old, a single mother of two children, and has been in her current line of work for four years. She is requesting her first loan from KADET LTD and plans to use it to buy more materials and threads to use in her business. In the future, Elizabeth hopes to open a boutique and beauty shop in her town.

loans.use: to buy more supplies and materials for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Clara Rocio

texts.es: Clara nació y vive en la Libertad. Siempre le a gustado las manualidades por ello realizo un curso de fomix cuando estaba de estancia en las Islas Galápagos, luego de eso se fue especializando en diferentes areas. Al principio lo hacía de manera personal pero al ver que su trabajo gustaba empezó a realizarlos para la venta. Se dedica a su negocio de lunes a viernes y lo realiza sola, por lo general empieza en las tardes ya que en la mañana realiza la compra del material. Clara nos comenta que el mayor riesgo que presenta es la delincuencia al momento de viajar a Guayaquil ya que lo hace en carro particular. Su esposo Walter es marino de guerra y se encuentra laborando en la capitanía de Salinas. Tiene 3 hijos menores de edad que asisten a la escuela fiscal. Con el préstamo va a comprar fomix material que utiliza para la creación de sorpresas para fiestas infantiles.
texts.en: Clara was born and lives in La Libertad.  She has always enjoyed craft and so she took a course in making handicrafts with Eva foam when she was staying in the Galapagos Islands.  Since then she has specialized in different areas.  At first she started making her products as a hobby but she saw that people liked her work and so started to make products for sale.  Clara works in her business from Monday to Friday and works alone.  She generally starts working in the afternoon as she buys her materials in the morning.  Clara tells us that the biggest risk she faces is crime when she travels to Guayaquil as she travels in a private car.  Her husband, Walter, is in the navy and works in the port of Salinas.  The couple have three dependent children who attend a state school.  Clara will use this loan to buy Eva foam which she uses in making surprises for children's parties.

loans.use: to buy Eva foam

loans.name: Hacaga

texts.en:
Hacaga is 26 years old.  He finished school with A grades and now studies at Teachers University in Agjabadi. He and his family are internally displaced people.  He is studying mathematics and physics and by the end of his education he will be a school teacher. 

Hacaga's father is paying for his education and is the only family member who is working, which is why paying for the last two years of Hacaga's schooling has become challenging. To cover his tuition fees, Hagaga is requesting a loan for 1,000 AZN. He wishes to complete his education as soon as possible and start working.

loans.use: to pay university fees

loans.name: Sattar

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is a youth client age 29 years old, married and has three children.

Sattar has owned a shop since 2008, selling construction materials. He has sufficient experience in this field and knows about the needs of his customers. He has a good reputation and he is well known in the surrounding areas.

He applied for 3,000 USD as a "youth loan" to renovate his shop and to add more inventory. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: To renovate his shop and to add more inventory.

loans.name: Laila

texts.en:
Laila is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her son, who is a bank employee, appears in her Kiva profile photo, pictured in front of the store to deliver orders.

Laila is a 42-year-old woman. She is married and a mother to two sons and two daughters, all of them are above 18 years old.

Laila and her elder son, who is a bank employee, have a project to deliver orders. They contract with big stores and restaurants to deliver their orders to homes and institutions. They have two motorcycles that are used to deliver orders from one place to another, but they are not enough as the size of work is increased.

Laila is requesting a 3,000 USD loan from FATEN to help her cover the costs of purchasing two other motorcycles. This will help Laila and her son to handle all orders and deliver them in a short time and improve the family's income.

loans.use: To purchase two motorcycles to use in delivering of orders

loans.name: Providance

texts.en: Providance is 44 years old. She sells different types of home goods and clothes. She is married to a driver. They have 6 children and all of them go to school. She has requested the loan to add more items such as curtains, mattress covers, and bed sheets. The profits from the business will be used to make more savings. She wants to see her business prosper in the future.

loans.use: To buy more items for sale such as curtains and mattress covers.

loans.name: Farindaris

texts.en: Farindaris is 31 years old, married and the mother of a three-year-old child. To earn a living, she began running a grocery store in 2005. Since joining Faulu Kenya, she has grown her business because she has received training on business management and secured easy access to financial resources. She hopes to expand her business in the future, and has applied for a loan for 50,000 Kenyan shillings to buy pineapples, melons, bananas and vegetables to sell to her customers.

loans.use: to buy pineapples, melons, bananas and vegetables to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.es:
Trinidad tiene 58 años de edad, es casado y tiene 3 hijos y vive en la ciudad de Choloma, Cortes.
Don Trinidad se dedica a una actividad que es hacer lazos, cabuyas y hamacas. Lleva ejerciendo esta actividad desde hace 26 años. Este negocio le ha permitido mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia. y con los financiamientos que ODEF le ha proporcionando ha logrado mantener estable su negocio.
Con el préstamo que solicita de 21,000 lempiras es para invertir en comprar materiales(cabuya) para elaborar los accesorios para la venta.
Su meta es mejorar su negocio para que sus ingresos sean rentables.
texts.en:
Trinidad is 58 years old and married.  He has three children, and he lives in the city of Choloma, Cortes.

Trinidad devotes himself to the business activity of making cords, pita rope, and hammocks.  He has been doing this for 26 years.  This business has allowed him to improve his quality of life and that of his family.  With the loans that ODEF has given him he has managed to keep his business stable.

The loan that he is requesting for 21,000 lempiras is to buy materials (pita fiber) to make the accessories that he sells.  His goal is to improve his business so that his revenue will be profitable.

loans.use: to buy pita fiber to make ropes and hammocks to sell.

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en: Sylvia is 29 years old and the single mother of three children. For the last year, she has earned a living by operating a grocery store in Nakuru town. She is requesting her first loan from KADET LTD and plans to use it to buy more vegetables and fruits such as bananas, oranges and mangoes to sell to her customers. In the future, Sylvia hopes to grow her business and open a wholesale shop, because this will allow her to earn more money and provide a good education to her children.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Marie Gorette

texts.en: Marie Gorette is 40 years old, married and the mother of three children. For the last three years, she has earned a living by selling bananas. Marie is requesting a loan to buy more bananas to sell to her customers. She plans to use the profits made possible by this loan to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy bananas to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Lisida Marilu

texts.es:
Lisida tiene 22 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene un hijo de 8 meses de edad, vive con su madre y dos hermanas en la ciudad de Choloma, Cortes.
Lisida toda su vida se ha dedicado ha atender su negocio de pulpería. Ella vende productos alimenticios como manteca, frijoles, harina, arroz, azúcar y productos de abarrotería. Ha trabajado al lado de su madre desde muy pequeña y creció con la convicción de tener su propio negocio para generar sus propios ingresos.
Solicita un préstamo de 10,000 lempiras para invertir en la compra de productos alimenticios como arroz, manteca, harina, frijoles, harina, etc.  Para surtir mas su negocio y poder obtener mas ganancias.
Su meta es incrementar más sus ingresos y mejorar su vida familiar.
texts.en:
Lisida, 22, is a single mother; she has an 8 month old son.  She lives with her mother and two sisters in the city of Choloma, Cortes.

Lisida has spent her entire life tending to her grocery store.  She sells foodstuffs like lard, beans, flour, rice, sugar and groceries.  She’s worked alongside her mother since she was very little and grew up with the determination to have her own business to earn her own income.

She’s asking for a 10,000 lempira loan to buy foodstuffs like rice, lard, flour, beans, flour, etc. to better stock her store and be able to earn more profits.  Her goal is to increase her income and to improve her family life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her store.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: For the last 13 years, Eunice has earned a living by running a beauty salon in Nakuru town. She is 43 years old, married and the mother of three children who are 20, 13 and five years old. She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD, which she plans to use to buy more supplies for her salon, including weaves and braids. In the future, Eunice hopes to increase her income by opening a cosmetics shop.

loans.use: to buy supplies for a beauty salon.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann has a clothing shop in Nakuru and has operated it for three years. She sells both clothes and shoes. The shop has been very profitable. Ann is 23 years old and is married to Arthur. They have one six-year-old child.

Ann plans to use this loan to buy more shirts and trousers to sell in her shop. With the anticipated profits, Ann plans to buy more varieties of shoes as well.

In the future, she hopes to open a big boutique and to supply clothes to various traders, thus increasing her income and allowing her to provide a good standard of living for her family.

loans.use: To buy more shirts and trousers to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Flor Daisy

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Parque A La Madre se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente. 

En este lugar vive la señora Francisca, tiene 62 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene 3 hijos  todos mayores de edad, el menor de ellos aun vive en su casa. El esposo es chofer.
 
Ella aprendió corte y confección en una academia de la localidad, tiene un pequeño taller de costura y bazar en su casa, allí ella se dedica a confeccionar todo tipo de ropa, para damas, caballeros y niños, aunque reconoce que lo que más le gusta elaborar es ropa de mujer o de niñas, ella  trabaja a base de pedidos de personas particulares que llegan hasta su taller para que les confeccione sus prendas y en temporadas de ingreso a clases lo que más confecciona es  uniformes para escuelas y colegios, nos cuenta que ella vende sus productos de bazar y confecciona sus prendas a la mismo tiempo y su hijo de vez en cuando le ayuda con el bazar. Lleva más de 10 años con su negocio y le va muy bien. La mercadería para el bazar la compra en Guayaquil cada vez que necesita.

Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar telas, otros materiales para la costura y artículos de bazar. Esta casi desde el inicio  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos para seguir adelante.
 
Sus sueños son seguir adelante y tener buena salud.
texts.en:
The “Parque a La Madre” communal bank meets every fifteen days in Jipijapa Canton, a canton known as “Sultana del Café” because of the extensive plantations of coffee of incomparable taste there, for its cuisine and for the warm-heartedness of its people.

Francisca, 62, lives here; she’s in a common law relationship and has three adult children.  The youngest still lives at home and her husband’s a driver.

She learned dressmaking at a local academy.  She has a small sewing workshop and general store at home.  She makes all types of clothes there for women, men and children although she admits that what she likes to make best is clothes for women and girls.  She works based on prior orders from individuals who come by her shop to have clothes made and during the beginning of each school term what she makes most is uniforms for schools and high schools.  She tells us that she sells her general merchandise and makes clothes at the same time and her son helps her once in a while with the store.  She’s been in business more than ten years and she does very well.  She buys the merchandise for the store in Guayaquil whenever she needs to.

She will use this new loan to buy fabric and other sewing supplies and general merchandise for the store.  She’s been in the communal bank since its beginning and she likes it because of the help she gets from the loans to be able to continue forward.  Her dreams are to continue forward and to be in good health.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy coffee plants.

loans.name: Nouriya

texts.en:
Nouriya is from Iraq. She is 59 years old, married, and has four children, all of whom work.

Nouriya has been a tailor since 2001. She makes, repairs, and alters clothing, such as suits, coats, and trousers for women and children. She has experience in this field, a deep understanding of the local customers, and she knows their needs. Nouriya has a good reputation and is well known in the surrounding areas.

She is requesting a loan of $1800 to purchase two tailoring machines and a generator. Her goal is to earn more profits so she can provide a better life for her whole family.

loans.use: To purchase two tailoring machines and a generator.

loans.name: Huda

texts.en:
Huda is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband Khaled appears in her Kiva profile photo.

Huda is a 36-year-old woman who is married to Khaled. She is also a mother to four sons and one daughter. Her husband is employed, but he earns a low salary that is not enough to cover the family's needs.

Huda is requesting a loan from FATEN to help her cover the costs of purchasing new home furniture such as living room furniture and bedroom furniture for her children. These purchases will improve the family's home living conditions and offer Huda's children comfortable beds to sleep in.

About this loan product:
FATEN offers loans that are customized for Muslim borrowers. A key principle of Islam is the prohibition of charging interest on a loan. This prohibition is based on the belief that money is only a medium of exchange and has no value in itself. In order to offer loans in a manner that is consistent with borrowers' values, FATEN charges 0% interest on this loan. However, FATEN does charge a servicing fee to cover its costs. The loan amount you see listed on Kiva includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you according to this loan’s repayment schedule. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please click here.

loans.use: To purchase living room furniture and bedroom furniture

loans.name: Chantal

texts.en: Chantal is 40 years old. She is married to a carpenter. She has been in the business of selling spices for 11 years. She has requested the loan to buy more spices to sell. She plans to use the profits from the business to build her own house. And she wants to work hard toward a better future.

loans.use: To buy spices for resale

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is a youth client who is 27 years old, married, and has three children.

Alaa has owned a food market since 2003. He sells soft drinks, juices, groceries, cheese, frozen beef, chicken and fish, and dairy products. He has sufficient experience in this field and a deep understanding of local customers and their needs. He has a good reputation and is well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting a 2,400 USD "youth loan" in order to pay the annual rent and to add more inventory to his market. He is aiming to gain more profits in order to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent and to add more inventory

loans.name: Walter

texts.en:
Walter is 34 years old, married, and has two children. To earn a living, he does shoe repairs. He has engaged in the business for four years. He has employed four people in the business. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has managed to grow his business.
Walter has requested 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy leather for repairing shoes.

loans.use: to buy leather for repairing shoes.

loans.name: Emily Makokha

texts.en: Emily is a 47-year-old woman. She has three sons and three daughters. Previously, she was involved in farming and she decided to change her business to running a grocery store. She has been determined and focused on expanding her business into wholesale. She sells items such as tomatoes, onions, beans, etc. Emily's business is located within a busy market and her customers are regulars who usually visit the market. Her business environment is sometimes faced with challenges like shortages of vegetables. This affects her business since she sometimes has no vegetables to sell. Previously, Emily requested a loan from SMEP DTM of KES 20,000 which she managed to repay. Now, she is requesting a loan of KES 35,000 to add more stock of maize and beans to her inventory.

loans.use: to buy maize and beans.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is 28 years old and married to Francis. They have one child aged 10 years old. Eunice works in a beauty salon in Nakuru town. From this income, she is able to provide for her family's needs.

She has applied for a loan of KES 20,000, which she plans to use to buy a blow-drying machine, hair weaves, and oil. She hopes to be able to start her own salon business.

In the future, Eunice hopes to own a big beauty and cosmetics shop and get more income. With this extra income, she hopes to give her child a good education.

loans.use: to buy buy a blow-drying machine, hair weaves, and oil.

loans.name: Epiphanie

texts.en: Epiphanie is mother of three children. She is 26 years old. She owns a butcher shop and she has spent 8 years in that business. She has requested the loan to buy more meat to sell. With the profits from this, she hopes to buy a house. In the future, Epiphanie would like to have an expanded business.

loans.use: to buy more meat to sell.

loans.name: Habiba

texts.en:
Habiba is 54 years old, married, and has four children.  To earn a living, she sells milk, which she has been doing for seven years. Habiba also farms to supplement her income.  

Habiba is requesting a loan for 50,000 KES, which she will use to buy milk to sell.  Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to expand her business because she has been trained in business management skills.  Habiba hopes to have a permanent business premise in the future.

loans.use: to purchase milk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To add more stock of shirts and trousers for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and coffee plants.

loans.name: Jeremiah

texts.en:
Jeremiah is a businessman who runs a retail shop. He has engaged in this business since 2005 and has employed one person. He also does dairy farming to earn extra income. He has improved his business since he joined Faulu Kenya because he has been able to access financial resources easily.
He hopes to expand his business in the future.  He has requested 100,000 Kenya shillings (KES) to open a mobile phone money-transfer business.

loans.use: to open a mobile phone money-transfer business.

loans.name: Egide

texts.en: Egide is 39 years old. He has four children between seven and twelve years old, all of whom are enrolled in school. He has owned a supermarket for one year. With the loan he has requested, he will buy more items such as biscuits, sodas, snacks, and beverages to sell. Egide plans to use the profits from the business to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy more items such as biscuits, sodas, snacks, and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther sell assorted fruits and fresh juice in Nakuru town and has been in the business for the past four years. She is 27 years old and married to Antony, who is a businessman. Esther is also a mother of four children.

This will be her first loan. She plans to use the amount to buy more stock of fruits to sell and have enough stock to make mango, avocado, and pineapple juice. She also plans to use part of the loan amount to expand her fruit stand and be able to serve more customers.

In the future, Esther hopes to grow her business and supply fruit juice to various customers in town. Ultimately, she hopes to make more income and improve the standard of living of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits to sell and have enough stock to make mango, avocado, and pineapple juice.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter has a motorcycle transport business in Nakuru town and has been in the business for the past three years. He is 30 years old and has one child who is five years old.

This will be his first loan from KADET LTD. He plans to use this loan amount to service and repair his motorcycle so that it can be in good condition and serve his customers well.

In the future, Peter hopes to buy a vehicle and invest in a vehicle transport business.

loans.use: to service and repair his motorcycle.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome owns a butcher shop in Nakuru and has operated it for the past three years. She is 25 years old, married to Peter, and together they have four school-aged children.

This is her first loan from KADET. Salome plans to use the loan to buy goats for slaughter, so she will have enough meat to sell.

Salome hopes to open another such business and thereby increase her income, thus allowing her to provide for all the basic needs of her family.

loans.use: To buy goats for her butcher shop.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
