Susan is a resident of Likoni, Kenya. She owns a clothing shop where she sells clothes and bags. Susan is married and has two children. The business has been supporting Susan and her family for the last two years. She received the money to start the business from her husband.

Susan is applying for a loan of 62,650 Kenyan shillings (KES) to purchase new clothes for sale at the business. The extra income from this business will help her pay for her children’s school fees. Her ambition is to expand the business into a fully stocked boutique.

The challenges for her business are the seasonal business climate and finding customers.

loans.use: To buy new clothes for sale at her business.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel practices farming in Njabini town, and has generated profits from the sale of maize, potatoes and beans that he has harvested.

This loan will be Samuel's third; he has repaid his previous loans on time and in full.  He plans to use this loan to buy manure, fertilizer and seedlings to plant during this planting season.

In the future, Samuel hopes to improve his farming methods and thereby increase his income.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizer and seedlings.

loans.name: Naftali

texts.en:
Naftali is a resident of Likoni, Kenya. He owns a grocery shop that has been in operation for the last three years. He has two children. Naftali started the business from savings he made out of casual jobs at construction sites. The business now hosts a vegetables and cereals shop.

Naftali is applying for a loan of 62,650 Kenyan shillings (KES) to purchase more grocery stock of rice, beans, and vegetables. 

The additional income from this loan will help Naftali pay for his children's school fees and also start other projects. His ambition is to become a wholesaler, despite the challenge of price fluctuations.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery stock of rice, beans, and vegetables.

loans.name: Beria

texts.en: Beria, age 41, is a mother of six children. Five of them attend school and the youngest is not yet school-age. Beria has been selling spices for ten years. With the loan, she will buy more spices to sell. The profits from the business will be used to buy a house.

loans.use: to buy more spice to sell.

loans.name: Gs Nobre Group

texts.fr:
Mme FATOUMATA est la responsable du groupe  GS NOBRE. Elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants. Le plus âgé a 18 ans et le moins âgé a 09 ans. 03vont à l’école et elle a 06 personnes en charge.

Mme vend des condiments en gros depuis 13ans. Elle s’approvisionne  sur place car les grossistes viennent les livrer. Ses clients sont les amis et voisins.

Elle veut s’acheter 03 sacs de concombre ; 04 sacs d’oignons ; 03 sacs de poivrons  et 03 sacs de courgettes. 

Mme épargne ses économies  et ambitionne  agrandir son commerce et avoir le monopole.
texts.en:
Fatoumata is the leader of the GS Nobre group. She is married and the mother of four children. The eldest is 18 and the youngest is nine, and three of the children are in school. Fatoumata has a total of six people to look after. 

Fatoumata has been selling food supplies in bulk for 13 years. Her suppliers deliver her stock directly to her at home. Her customers are friends and neighbours. She would like to buy three bags of cucumbers, four bags of onions, three bags of peppers and three bags of courgettes. She is saving her money and her ambition is to expand her business and become the sole supplier in the area.

loans.use: to buy 3 bags of cucumbers, 4 bags of onions, 3 bags of peppers and 3 bags of courgettes.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma is a mother of two; neither of her children attend school. She operates a tailoring business and has been in this business for the last four years. Fatuma rents a house that has electricity but no piped water. Credit defaulters pose a major challenge to her business. She joined Yehu to gain access to funds for her business. She operates her business from home providing tailoring services to her neighbors and passersby. She intends to use the loan of Ksh 20000 to purchase clothing materials.

loans.use: to purchase clothing materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy coffee plants, fertilizer and to pay day laborers.

loans.name: Ruth Gathoni

texts.en:
This will be Ruth's fourth loan.  She plans to buy fertilizer and seedlings as well as chemical sprays and pesticides.

Ruth used her previous loan to buy seeds to plant on her farm. She was able to complete planting and harvesting and it was very profitable. Ruth was able to repay the full loan amount and in good time.

In the future, Ruth hopes to invest more in her farming business and increase her income thereby improving her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seedlings, chemical sprays and pesticides.

loans.name: Fadhila

texts.en: Fadhila has been operating a tailoring business for the past four years. Her other sources of income include the earnings of her husband. Fadhila dreams of opening a shop in the future. She lives in her own house, which has electricity but no running water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. Fadhila joined Yehu to get financial support. A loan of Ksh 20000 will help her to purchase clothing material.

loans.use: to purchase clothing material.

loans.name: Clarisse

texts.en: Clarisse is twenty-five years old. She owns a butcher shop which she has been running for the past twelve years. With the loan she will buy more meat to sell. With the profits from the business, she plans to buy a house.

loans.use: To buy meat to sell.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
Jacinta has been practicing livestock farming in Ndunyu Njeru town. It has been very profitable--the sale of cattle as well as the milk from the dairy cows. She is 53 years old and married to Paul, who is also a livestock farmer, and they have four children.

This will be her second loan, having paid all of her previous loan amount well and in good time. She plans to use this loan amount to buy another cow and add to the stock of cattle that she has.

In the future, Jacinta hopes to invest more in her cattle business and make more income, thereby improving the living standard of her family.

loans.use: To buy another cow

loans.name: Karinn Lorena

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Parque A La Madre se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente. 

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Karinn, tiene 40 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 20 y 15 años  de edad que estudian en universidad y colegio. Su esposo es chofer.

Ella es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto poder ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa por catalogo y productos de Esika (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja tres días a la semana de dos a tres horas al día ya que es un trabajo que no tiene horario fijo, ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene 10 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien, nos cuenta que lo que más vende son los perfumes y cosméticos ya que según dice son muy buenos.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa. Lleva 6 años  en el Banco Comunal, es la secretaria del grupo y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer.
 
Su sueño es tener una boutique.
texts.en:
The “Parque a La Madre” communal bank meets every fifteen days in Jipijapa Canton, a canton known as the “Sultana del Café” due to the extensive plantations of coffee of incomparable flavor there, for its cuisine and for the warm-heartedness of its people.

We met Karinn, 40, here.  She’s married and they have two children who are 20 and 15 years old attending university and secondary school.  Her husband’s a driver.

She’s a housewife who in order to earn her own income and help her husband with household expenses sells clothes via catalogue and Esika brand products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumery and women’s accessories).  She works three days a week from two to three hours daily since it’s a job with no fixed work schedule.  She sells her items on credit and collects payment every 8 days.  She has 10 years’ experience in this line of work and she does very well.  She tells us that what she sells most is perfume and cosmetics which according to her are very good.

This loan is to buy perfume, creams, cosmetics and clothes.  She’s been in the communal bank six years and she’s the group secretary; she likes it because the payments are easy to make.  Her dream is to own a boutique.

loans.use: to buy perfume, creams, cosmetics and clothes.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is a businessman who provides services such as video shooting and editing. He has been in this business since 2007. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, Richard has managed to grow his business because he has been trained in business management. He has also managed to access financial resources easily.
Richard has requested 40,000 Kenya shillings to buy a laptop computer.

loans.use: To buy a laptop computer.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter does farming in Olkalau town, where he keeps sheep as well as plants (cash crops) for sale. He is 44 years old and married to Beth, who is also a farmer, and together they have five children.

Having paid all his previous loan amount well and in good time, this will be his third loan. He plans to use this loan to buy 10 sheep and a 50kg bag of fertilizer for planting during this planting season.

In the future, Peter hopes to invest more in his farming for more income, which will thereby enable him to provide a good education for his children.

loans.use: To buy sheep and fertilizer

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en: Vincent is a 43-year-old married man with six children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. His personal goals are to educate his children, build a permanent house for residence, and buy a car. He has been dealing in the mixed-farming business for the last 14 years. After starting on family land, he thereafter bought his own land and started farming. He has been facing hardships of price fluctuations, inflation, and seasonal weather changes, however he has a vision of diversifying his business to include farming, buying land to grow crops, and expanding his business to new markets. Vincent needs a loan to buy seeds and dig soil and water conservation trenches.

loans.use: to buy seeds and dig soil and water conservation trenches.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen used his previous loan of 80,000 Kenya shillings to buy utensils for resale. With the additional stock, he made more profits. His business has grown and he has employed one person. He has also managed to start a business selling water.  He has requested another loan of 60,000 Kenya shillings to buy cooking pots, plates, and cups for resale.

loans.use: to buy cooking pots, plates, and cups for resale.

loans.name: Mariana De Lourdes

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Parque A La Madre se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente. 

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Mariana, tiene 39 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de  19, 17 y el menor de 1 año de edad, los mayores  estudian en universidad. Su esposo es comerciante.

Ella con la finalidad de ayudar a su esposo a llevar la dura carga de mantener el hogar realiza el crédito para que él lo utilice en su negocio, el esposo tiene una carnicería en su casa en el cual vende carne de cerdo y de res, nos cuenta nuestra amiga que él se desplaza a los campos a comprar los chanchos, luego los lleva a los centros de faenamiento para obtener la carne que luego lleva a vender a su local, en cuanto a la carne de res la compra a otros comerciantes en el mismo centro. Él lleva más de 20 años con este negocio trabajando todos los días para sacar adelante a su familia.

Este crédito es para comprar chanchos y carne de res para surtir el negocio. Esta desde el inicio  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque así puede ayudar a sus esposo en algo.

Su sueño es comprar un carro ya que tienen que fletar carro para comprar los chanchos.
texts.en:
The “Parque a La Madre” communal bank meets every fifteen days in Jipijapa Canton, a canton known as the “Sultana del Café” due to the extensive plantations of coffee of incomparable flavor there, for its cuisine and for the warm-heartedness of its people.

We met Mariana, 39, here.  She’s married and they have three children who are 19, 17 and 1 years old; the older ones are attending university.  Her husband’s a merchant.

Aiming to help her husband carry the heavy load of supporting the home, she’s taking out the loan so that he can use it in his business.  Her husband has a butcher shop at home where he sells pork and beef.  Our girlfriend tells us that he goes off into the fields to buy the pigs which he then takes to the slaughterhouse to get the meat and then take to sell at his shop.  As for the beef, he buys it from other merchants downtown.  He’s been in business more than 20 years working every day to move his family forward.

This loan is to buy pigs and beef to stock the business.  She’s been in the communal bank since its beginning and she likes it because she’s able to help her husband with something this way.  Her dream is to buy a car because they have to hire transportation to go buy the pigs.

loans.use: to buy pigs and beef.

loans.name: Lilia Judith

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Parque A La Madre se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente. 

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Lidia, tiene 62 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos mayores de edad, uno de ellos aun vive en su casa. Su esposo es comerciante.

Ella para salir adelante junto a su esposo tienen una tienda de comestibles en su casa,  allí vende todo tipo de productos, como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, legumbres, verduras y frutas,  además de varios artículos de bazar y papelería, allí junto  a su esposo  trabajan todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde. Tienen más de 30 años con su negocio y nos cuenta que es como han salido adelante y han formado a sus hijos gracias a esto, además que su negocio es muy concurrido por la atención que se les dan a los clientes y es por eso que sus clientes prefieren su local para realizar sus comprar diarias.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar productos de primera necesidad y útiles escolares para aprovechar la temporada de clases. Lleva 5 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos. 

Su sueño es que toda su familia goce de muy buena salud.
texts.en:
The 'Parque a la Madre' community bank meet every two weeks in Jipijapa canton.  This canton is known as 'the Sultana of coffee' owing to its extensive coffee crops which have a flavor that is second-to-none.  It is also known for its cuisine and the warmth of its people.

Here we meet Lidia who is 62 years old, married, and has four adult children.  One of her children still lives at home.  Her husband is a salesman.

In order to get ahead in life, Lidia and her husband run a grocery store in their home.  There they sell all kinds of products such as rice, sugar, oil, detergents, vegetables, greens and fruit.  They also sell other miscellaneous goods and stationery.  Lidia and her husband work there every day from 6.00am to 8.00pm and sometimes until even later.  They have been in their business for more than 30 years and Lidia tells us that it is how they have made progress and educated their children.  Their business is very busy because of the good service they provide to their customers.  Their customers prefer to do their daily shopping at their store.

Lidia will use this loan to buy basic household products and school supplies so that she can make the most of the school season.  She has been a member of her community bank for five years and likes it because of the help that she receives through the loans.  Her dream is for her entire family to enjoy very good health.

loans.use: to buy basic household products and school supplies

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a 37-year-old married man with two children. He has had a livestock-trading business for the last three years and gets a monthly income of 10,000 shillings (KES).

This will be his first loan from KADET LTD. He plans to use the entire loan to purchase goats and sheep to fatten for sale. He will invest back into the business profit that he earns. 


In the future, he wants to improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase goats and sheep to fatten for sale.

loans.name: Sarah T. B.

texts.en: Sarah, 32, lives in Buchanan. She is married and has three children between 5 and 12 years old, all of whom are in school and live at home. Sarah is a college graduate, and her husband is a businessman. Since 2005, Sarah has been running a shop (bar and restaurant), where she sells drinks, hot food, and other items. Sarah says that one problem she faces is that she is not able to meet most of her customers' demands. She is requesting a loan to purchase more alcoholic drinks (beer, Guinness, big apple, god father), soft drinks, soda drinks, rice by bag and other items for her business. In the near future, she wants to send her children to college and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more alcoholic drinks (beer, Guinness, big apple, god father), soft drinks, soda drinks, rice by bag, and other items for her business

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en: Marjorie is single with two children, and all of them go to school. She takes care of her mother. She operates a retail shop at the market. She works seven days a week. She has been in business for three years. She also works at the school as a teacher to earn additional income. She has applied for a loan of SHS 1,200,000 from MCDT-SACCO to buy sugar, rice, flour, soap, cooking oil, and salt.    Her major challenges include seasonality and transportation. Marjorie aspires to see her business grow into a wholesale business and also to educate her children to a college-level. She would also like to build a commercial house. She lives in her own house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expenses include paying school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, rice, soap, cooking oil, and salt

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en: Christopher is a 36-year-old married man with three children. They live in Fort Portal, Uganda. His personal goal is to educate his children, build a permanent home, and buy a car. He has been dealing in animal sales for the past three years, starting with savings from his wages earned while working at a tea company. His major hardships are customers not paying on time, high fuel and transportation costs, and seasonal weather. However, Christopher's goal is to diversify his business to include retailing, hiring employees to help expand his business, and buying land to grow crops. Christopher needs a loan to buy cross-breed cows to sell.

loans.use: to buy cross-breed cows to sell.

loans.name: Ganzaya

texts.en:
Ganzaya is a 25-year-old man who was married very recently and lives in outer ger district. This district lacks the basic infrastructure of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Currently Ganzaya lives with his spouse in his mother-in-law’s small and very old house.

He is very ambitious so he decided to renovate his living space. Therefore, Ganzaya is requesting a loan of 3,900,000 Mongolian Tugriks to purchase all necessary construction materials for his renovation work. 

He says, “We are a young family, so I wish to make everything in my life very orderly and new, because our married life has just started and of course I want to live happy and safe with my spouse."

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for rebuilding his old house.

loans.name: Rosa Marlene

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Parque A La Madre se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente. 

En este lugar vive la señora Rosa, tiene 38 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 17 y 13 años los mismos que estudian en universidad y colegio. El marido es chofer y mecánico de motocicletas. 

Ella es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto poder ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa y zapatos por catalogo, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, sale tres días por semana a recorre la ciudad ofreciendo sus productos. Parte del crédito lo utiliza para que el esposo compre repuestos para las motocicletas que el arregla y así se gana algo mas a parte de su trabajo, ella lleva 2 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar ropa, zapatos y repuestos de motocicletas. Lleva 2 años  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con el primer crédito empezó su negocio.
 
Sus sueños son tener un local mas grade para la venta de repuestos y vender toda clase de repuestos para motos y automóviles.
texts.en:
The “Parque a La Madre” communal bank meets every fifteen days in Jipijapa Canton, a canton known as the “Sultana del Café” due to the extensive plantations of coffee of incomparable flavor there, for its cuisine and for the warm-heartedness of its people.

Rosa, 38, lives here.  She’s in a common law relationship and has two children who are 17 and 13 years old and are attending university and secondary school.  Her husband’s a driver and motorcycle mechanic.

She is a housewife who in order to obtain her own resources to be able to help her husband with household expenses sells clothes and shoes via catalogue door to door.  She goes out three days a week throughout the city offering her products.  Part of the loan will be used so that her husband can buy spare parts for the motorcycles he repairs to earn more in addition to his labor.  She’s been in business two years and she does very well.

This loan is to buy shoes, clothes and motorcycle spare parts.  She’s been in the communal bank two years and likes it because she started her business with her first loan.  Her dream is to have a larger locale for the spare parts sales and to sell all kinds of spare parts for cars and motorcycles.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes and motorcycle spare parts.

loans.name: Elisse

texts.fr: Après avoir arrêté ses études en troisième au collège, Eliasse s'est engagé dans la maçonnerie comme manœuvre.Il mène en même temps de l'élevage de poulets pour augmenter ses revenus.Il est célibataire mais il est le seul soutien de sa mère et de ses sœurs. Afin de faire une nouvelle opération d'aviculture , il sollicite un pret de 200000f pour acheter pour acheter 150 poussins. Son ambition est de construire un grand poulailler.
texts.en:
Having stopped studying when he was part-way through high school, Elisse started work in the building trade. In addition to this work, he raises chickens to supplement his income. He is unmarried, but has to support his mother and sisters alone. 

In order to start a new poultry venture, he is requesting a loan of 200 000 francs for the purchase of 150 chicks. His ambition is to build a large henhouse.

loans.use: to buy 150 chicks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for his school fees

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 40 years old and married with four children.  He sells newspapers and magazines to earn a living.  He employs three people in his business.  Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been trained in business management skills. This has helped him to improve his business.

Joseph hopes to expand his business in the future. He has requested a loan of 85,000 Kenya Shillings to buy more magazines.

loans.use: To buy more magazines for his business

loans.name: Henry

texts.en: Henry is a 34-year-old married man. He has 2 children, a 1-year-old and a 2-year-old. He describes himself as humble and God-fearing. Previously, he was involved in farming but he saw a need from within the slum of supplying clean water. He started a water-selling business and he has been operating it for the last four years. His business is located in a slum area where there is a shortage of water and his primary customers are slum dwellers. He describes his biggest business challenge as a lack of better transportation to water facilities since he uses his own hands to carry water and distribute to customers. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy a new cart. Previously, Henry requested a loan of KES 20,000 from SMEP DTM which he managed to pay. He aspires to run a retail shop business within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will raise a happy family and will be able to meet their financial needs with ease.

loans.use: to buy a water cart for distributing water to customers.

loans.name: Bintihamis

texts.en: Bintihamis is a married woman with six children, two of whom are in school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. For the last 10 years, she has been selling coconuts from her home mostly to her neighbors and people from the neighboring towns. Bintihamis describes lack of capital to be her major challenge. She aims to open a grocery very soon. The loan of KSH 10,000 will enable her to purchase coconuts to sell.

loans.use: to purchase coconuts to sell.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en: Theresa is 45 years old and lives in Airport. She is married and has two children, ages 12 and 29. One of them is in school and the oldest one help her mother with the business. Theresa did not go to school.For the past 15 years, she been selling used clothes. She started this business with money lent from her mother. A problem she is facing is less commodities. She is requesting a loan to purchase used clothes for her business. She likes her business because it helps her to save. Her plans are to build her house and become a big businesswoman.

loans.use: to purchase used clothes for her business

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en: Ronald is a 24-year-old married man with two children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has a personal goal of educating his children and building a permanent house for residence. He has been in the transport sector for the last two years after getting money from a saving cooperative in his village. He faces hardships such as customers not paying on time and high fuel and transportation costs. However, he has a vision of expanding his business to new areas. Ronald wants a loan to complete building his residential house.

loans.use: to complete building his residential house.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac is requesting his third loan of KES 60,000 from KADET LTD after paying the previous loans successfully. He wishes to use this amount to purchase phone accessories, power cables, extension cords, electric bulbs, and fuses.  

The anticipated amount will be used to plough back into the business and repay the loan. His dream is to expand his current business and start the same business in a different location.

loans.use: to purchase phone accessories, power cables, extension cords, electric bulbs, and fuses.

loans.name: Elsy Aracely

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Parque A La Madre se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente. 

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Elsy, tiene 38 años de edad, está casada pero no ha podido tener hijos aun. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura. 

Ella es una muy buena ama de casa que para ayudar a su esposo realiza el crédito para que él lo utilice en los gastos que originan sus cultivos, él tiene sembríos de maíz, maní y verduras, nos cuenta nuestra amiga que ya están en fechas de recolección del maíz y que ahora necesita del crédito para pagar mano de obra que le permitan recolectar sus frutos y así poder guardarlos un cierto tiempo para que los precios mejoren ya que si los vende en esta temporada los comerciantes le pagan muy poco y se le llevarían toda la ganancia de su trabajo, es por eso que con el crédito él puede esperar y sacar el mejor provecho de su esfuerzo en el campo.

Este crédito es para pagar mano de obra por el trabajo en la recolección del maíz, lleva 2 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que siempre le han brindado desde que está en el grupo.
 
Su sueño es tener un bebé para sentirse realizada como mujer y esposa.
texts.en:
The “Parque a La Madre” communal bank meets every fifteen days in Jipijapa Canton, a canton known as the “Sultana del Café” due to the extensive plantations of coffee of incomparable flavor there, for its cuisine and for the warm-heartedness of its people.

We met Elsy, 38, here.  She’s married but has been unable to have children yet.  Her husband works in agriculture.

She is a good housewife who in order to help her husband is taking out the loan so that he can use it to cover farming costs.  He has corn, peanut and vegetable crops and our girlfriend tells us that they are now in corn harvest season and money is needed to pay labor costs so that they will be able to harvest the corn in order to store it for certain time until prices improve because if they sell it now they get very little for it from the merchants and they’d lose all their profits from their labor.  This is why with the loan they can afford to wait and earn the maximum profits from their work in the fields.

This loan is to pay labor costs incurred by the corn harvesting.  She’s been in the communal bank for two years and likes it because of the help she’s always gotten since being part of this group.  Her dream is to have a baby in order to feel fulfilled as a wife and mother.

loans.use: to pay corn harvesting labor costs.

loans.name: Ndèye Yaga

texts.fr: Ndèye est une femme mariée , mère de trois enfants dont les deux fréquentent l'école. Elle exerce un commerce de produits alimentaires et d'encens depuis un an. Elle a ouvert un compte à l'UIMCEC et a pu constituer une petite épargne.Afin de renforcer son fonds de commerce, il sollicite un pret de 10000f pour acheter des denrées alimentaires. Son ambition est de renforcer d'avantage son alimentation.
texts.en:
Ndèye is married and the mother of three children, two of whom are in school. 

For a year Ndèye has been running a business selling food products and incense. She has opened an account with UIMCEC and has been able to save some money. In order to boost her business funds, she is requesting a loan of 100 000 francs for the purchase of food supplies. Her ambition is to further strengthen her food business.

loans.use: to buy food supplies.

loans.name: Yovito

texts.en: Yovito is a 38-year-old married man with four children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. His personal goal is to educate his children to attain degrees as a minimum qualification. He has been a retailer for the last ten years. He got the start-up capital from his wife's salary and the sale of goats and a cow. He faces hardships such as customers not paying on time, price fluctuations, and inflation. However, he has a vision of expanding his business to new areas. Yovito needs a loan to buy general merchandise such as sugar and salt to sell.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise such as sugar and salt to sell.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is a 26-year-old married woman with two children living in Kasese, Uganda.  She is a teacher and has been teaching for two years. Her personal goals are to educate her children to attain degrees and buy land for farming activities. Alice wants money to buy land for farming.

loans.use: To buy land for farming

loans.name: Elena Lorena

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Parque A La Madre se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente. 

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Elena, tiene 40 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de  22, 19 y 15años de edad, los mayores estudian en universidad y el menor en colegio. Su esposo es chofer y tiene un bus de transporte público.

Ella es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto poder ayudar a sus hijos en los gastos de sus estudios se dedica a la venta de ropa por catalogo y de productos Esika (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y trabaja tres días a la semana de dos a tres horas al día,  deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene tres años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien, nos cuenta que lo que más vende son los perfumes y cosméticos ya que según dice son muy buenos.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa por catálogos ya que tiene varios pedidos. Lleva 10 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos y los intereses bajos.

Su sueño es que sus hijos terminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
The Parque A La Madre Communal Bank meets every fifteen days in Jipijapa Canton.  This canton is known as “the Sultana of Coffee” because the coffee that is cultivated there has a unique flavor.  The canton is also known for its cuisine and for the warmth of its people.

The canton is also the home of Elena.  She is 40 years old, married, and has three children, ages 22, 19, and 15.  Her two oldest children are in university, while her youngest is in high school.  Elena’s husband drives a public transport bus for a living.

Elena is a homemaker who also has her own income so she can help pay for her children’s studies.  She earns money selling clothing from a catalogue, along with Esika products; these include beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and women’s accessories.  Elena sells her products going door to door and works three days a week, two to three hours per day.  She sells the items on credit and then collects payments every eight days.  She has been involved in this activity for three years and it is going very well.  She says that the perfumes and cosmetics are what sell the most, since they are very good quality.

Elena will use this loan to purchase perfumes, creams, cosmetics, and clothing from catalogues, since she already has orders for those particular products.  She has been a member of her communal bank for 10 years, and likes it because the loans are quickly disbursed and have low interest rates.

Elena’s dream is for her children to finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, creams, cosmetics, and clothing.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is a 35-year-old married woman with seven children living in Kasese, Uganda. She has been selling cassava for ten years. One hardship she faces is customers not paying on time.

Her personal goal is to educate her children, and her professional goal is to expand her business into new markets. Margret wants money to buy cassava for sale.

loans.use: to buy cassava for sale.

loans.name: Augustine

texts.en:
Augustine is a 54-year-old married man with seven children living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been in the retail business for 25 years. One hardship he faces is finding customers.

His personal goal is to educate his children, and his professional goal is to expand his business into new markets. Augustine wants money to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Martha T.

texts.en:
Martha T., aged 42, lives in Buchanan and is married with seven children aged 13 to 25 who live at home. For the past 15 years, she has been selling slippers, tubs and palm oil in the local market. She established her business with small loans from her mother. 

Martha T. is requesting a loan to purchase more slippers, tubs and palm oil to expand her business. In the future, she wants to build a house and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more slippers, tubs and palm oil to expand her business

loans.name: Janetha

texts.en: Janetha is 30 years old, and lives in Congo Town.  She is married with 3 children between 6 to 10 years old.  Her children attend school and live at home.  For the past four years she has been selling rice.  She started this business with money given to her by her husband.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice by the bag for her business.  Her plan is to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more rice by the bag for her business

loans.name: Edward

texts.en: Edward is a 44-year-old married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda.  He has personal goals of educating his children, building a permanent house, and buying a car.  He has been in the transport sector for the last two years, and he bought a motorcycle with a loan given to him by HOFOKAM.  He encounters hardships of seasonal weather, theft, and high fuel and transportation costs; however, he has a vision of buying land to grow crops to help buy another motorcycle, as the business is lucrative. Edward needs the loan to buy another motorcycle.

loans.use: To buy another motorcycle

loans.name: Watta

texts.en: Watta  lives in Sinkor. She is 30 years old, married with six children between the ages of 9 and 13. She has been running  a table in the market where she sells  palm oil.  She started this business with help from her father and learned this way of selling from him. She likes her business because it gives her profits and makes her popular. She is requesting a loan to buy more  palm oil for her business. Watta wants to earn more money to build a house since she has a piece of land.

loans.use: to buy more  palm oil for her business

loans.name: Eugene

texts.en:
Eugene is a 44-year-old married man with three children, and he takes care of four relatives. He sells various goods, such as juice, water, biscuits, sugar, and fresh milk, and he has been in this business for three years. His business is open from 6 a.m to 6 p.m seven days a week. 

Eugene has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to purchase various goods to sell. He will save any profits for his future and to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to purchase stock for his general store.

loans.name: Hamidou

texts.fr: Monsieur Hamidou vit au Sénégal. Il est âgé de 49 ans. Il est marié et évolue dans le secteur  du commerce et de  la restauration. Il gère un restaurant dans une grande rue du quartier ou il habite depuis plus de 20 ans. Il vend des repas  aux heures de déjeuner et de  diner. C’est une activité qu’il a choisi par nécessité  dans le but de subvenir à ses besoins sociaux. Son objectif est d’aider sa famille. Il est membre du guichet de l’U-IMCEC de la zone  depuis janvier 2002. Il a déjà remboursé 4 crédits antérieurs. Il sollicite un prêt de 300000 frs prévu pour l’achat de denrées alimentaires en grande quantité et a des prix plus compétitifs qui lui permettront  de préparer les plats qu’il commercialise. Son vœu est de renforcer d’avantage son activité au sein de son restaurant. Avec  l’accroissement de ses revenus réguliers il pourra améliorer les conditions de vie économique et sociale de sa famille et en meme temps assister ses parents.
texts.en:
Mr. Hamidou lives in Senegal. He is a 49-year-old married man who works in sales and food services. He runs a restaurant on a major street of the neighborhood where he has lived for over 20 years. He serves lunch and dinner. He chose this activity out of necessity to support himself. His goal is to assist his family. 

He became a member of the local U-IMCEC branch in January 2002 and has repaid four previous loans. He is now seeking a loan of 300,000 F to buy large quantities of food items at competitive prices. This will enable him to prepare the dishes that he sells to his customers. 

He hopes to bolster his restaurant business. An increase in his regular income would allow him to improve his family’s financial and social living conditions while helping to support his parents.

loans.use: to buy food for his restaurant business.

loans.name: C 13520 Ibereho Group

texts.en:
Alphonsine is 18 years old and single. She takes care of six relatives. She is the leader of a group called "C 13520 IBEREHO" in the local language. Alphonsine (the first person on the left in the photo) has four years of experience selling various foods such as potatoes, bananas, rice, sorghum etc. Her business is well-organized and she works from 7 a.m. until 5 p.m. every day of the week.

Alphonsine has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to purchase various foods such as potatoes, bananas, rice, sorghum, etc. to sell. With any profit, she will be able to save for the future and to re-invest in her business.

loans.use: To purchase  potatoes, bananas, rice, sorghum etc to sell.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is twenty-six years old and single. He has had a motorcycle business in Nakuru now for the last three years. He was introduced to KADET Ltd by one of the staff and this will be his first loan.

He plans  to use this loan amount to add on to his savings and purchase another motorcycle. In the future, David hopes to own a truck in the near future, to increase his income.

loans.use: to top up on  his savings and purchase another motorcycle

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen operates a posho mill in Nyahururu town and also sells dry maize and maize flour.  She is 37 years old, married to Simon who is a farmer, and together they have three schooling children. 

She was introduced to Kadet Ltd by one of our field officers.This will be her first loan and she plans to use it to buy more stock of maize to sell and use in her business.

In the future, Helen hopes to expand her business and supply flour and maize to schools and hotels.

loans.use: buy maize to resell

loans.name: Cintya

texts.es:
Cintya, es soltera, no tiene hijos y vive en la casa de su madre en la zona Chamoco chico de la ciudad de La Paz. La casa cuenta solamente con una habitación la cual la comparte con su madre.
Ella estudio solamente hasta el nivel secundario, no cuenta con seguro medico y por ahora se dedica a la venta de productos de la canasta familiar ya que tiene una  tienda de abarrotes y es por eso que necesita el crédito para  aumentar su capital y adquirir mas productos como ser arroz, azúcar, aceite, fideos y más productos para aumentar sus ingresos y  terminar sus estudios para apoyar a su madre ya que solo vive con ella.
El sueño que tiene Cintya, es mejorar su calidad de vida y a futuro construir otra habitación para ofrecerle seguridad y comodidad a su madre.
Es la segunda vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y la segunda vez con kiva.
Cyntia se trasladó a vivir con su madre quien estaba muy sola; de esta manera la acompaña y comprate con ella.
texts.en:
Cintya is single and has no children. She lives at her mother's house in the District of Chamoco Chico in the city of La Paz. The house only has one room that she shares with her mother.

Cintya only has a high school education. She also does not have health insurance, so now she sells basic household products from the grocery store that she manages. For this reason, she needs a loan to increase her capital for acquiring more products such as rice, sugar, oil, noodles, and other items so that she can have more earnings and finish her studies. This will help her to support her mother, who is the only one living with her.

Cintya dreams of improving her quality of life and building another room in the future so that she can offer her mother greater security and comfort. This is the second time she has worked with IMPRO and Kiva. Cyntia moved in with her mother because she was very lonely. Now she gets to be with her and share with her.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Parque A La Madre se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Jipijapa, cantón conocido con el nombre de la sultana del café por los extensos cultivos de café el cual tiene un sabor incomparable, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente. 

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Ana,  tiene 59 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen 10 hijos todos ellos  mayores de edad, la menor tiene 18 años de edad y es la que aun vive en su casa y estudia en la universidad. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura.

Ella además de ser una muy buena madre y esposa con la finalidad de ayudara a su esposo con los gastos que genera el hogar y una familia tan numerosa hace mas de 15 años empezó un negocio de venta de ropa y zapatos de todo tipo, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta ya que sale a recorrer cuatro días a la semana y al mismo tiempo cobra ya que deja a crédito a sus clientes. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil cada quince días o al mes de acuerdo a lo que necesite.
 
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y zapatos de todo tipo. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace 15 años  y le gusta porque gracias al primer crédito empezó su negocio.
 
Su sueño es ver que su hija  termine sus estudios y sea una  profesional.,
texts.en:
The "Banco Comunal Parque a La Madre" gets together every fifteen days in the canton of Jipijapa.  The canton is known as the "sultan of coffee" due to its extensive production of coffee with an incomparable flavor, for its gastronomy, and for the warmth of its residents.

This is where we met Ana.  She is 59 years old, she is married and she has 10 adult children, the youngest of whom is 18 years old, still lives at home, and studies in the university.  Ana's husband works in agriculture.

Ana is a very good mother and wife and helps her husband with the household expenses generated by such a large family.  More than 15 years ago she began a business of selling clothing and shoes of all styles.  She sells door-to-door four days per week and provides credit to her customers.  She goes to Guayaquil every fifteen days or every month, depending on what she needs, to buy more stock.

This loan will enable Ana to buy more stock such as pants, blouses, shirts, and shoes of all styles.  She has been a part of Banco Comunal for 15 years and it is thanks to this organization that she was able to start her business.

Her dream is to see her daughter finish her studies and become a professional.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, shirts and shoes.

loans.name: Melida Eudocia

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Mujeres Unidas se reúne cada quince días en la ciudadela San Alejo de la bellísima ciudad de Portoviejo, capital manabita conocida como la Ciudad de Los Reales Tamarindos, ciudad de gente hospitalaria y amable que ofrece muchos atractivos a cuantos la visitan.

En este lugar vive la señora Melida, ella tiene 76 años de edad, hace varios años su esposo falleció  y quedo viuda, pero de esa relación tuvo tres hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad, pero una de sus hijas aun vive con ella, con sus hijos los mismos que son la felicidad de nuestra amiga.

Ella tiene un local de venta de repuestos automotrices negocio que lo tiene desde que su esposo estaba vivo y que al partir tuvo que hacerse cargo ella con la ayuda de su hija, allí trabajan  todos los días desde las 8 h00 hasta las 17h00, tiene 14 años con su local y nos cuenta que para surtirse de mercadería su hija viaja a Manta, Quito  o  a Guayaquil lugar donde compran directamente de los mayoristas.
 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar más repuestos automotrices para tener de todo para sus clientes. Es socia del Banco Comunal hace 6 años y le gusta por los beneficios que brinda la institución. 

Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y tener salud sobre todo.
texts.en:
The “Mujeres Unidas” (United Women) communal bank meets every fifteen days in the San Alejo neighborhood in the very beautiful city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, and known as the “City of the Royal Tamarinds.”  It’s a city of hospitable, kind people that offers many attractions to visitors.

Melida, 76, lives here.  Her husband died several years ago and she was left widowed but she had three children during her marriage who are all now adults.  However, one of her daughters still lives with her; her daughter’s children are the joy of our girlfriend’s life.

She has an automobile spare parts shop that she’s had since her husband was alive and that she had to take over with help from her daughter when he died.  They work there every day from 8am until 5pm.  She’s had the shop for 14 years and she tells us that in order to stock up on merchandise her daughter travels to Manta, Quito or to Guayaquil to buy directly from wholesalers.

She will use this loan to buy more automobile spare parts to have everything for her customers.  She’s been a member of the communal bank for six years and likes it because of the benefits the institution provides.  Her goal is to continue forward and above all to be in good health.

loans.use: to buy automobile spare parts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase chickens for sale.

loans.name: Aloys

texts.en:
Aloys is 50 years old and married with five children  He also takes care of six relatives. He sells timber and he has been in this business for five years. His business is open from 6 am to 6.30 pm every day except Sunday. 

Aloys has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more timber for re-sale. With any profits, he will be able to save for his future and reinvest in his business.

loans.use: To purchase more timber for re-sale.

loans.name: Teresiah

texts.en:
Teresiah is 41 years old married lady, with five children. She does farming in Kambaa and has been in the business for three years. She gets a monthly income of 18,500 shillings. 

This will be her first loan with KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire loan to buy farm inputs that is, fertilizer, pesticides, and seedlings, since this will improve her farming business hence good income. 


With the profits, she will open a second-hand clothes shop. In the future, she wants to expand her business and be a successful farmer.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs e.g fertilizer, pesticides, and seedlings

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy bras, tops, undergarments and handkerchiefs to sell.

loans.name: Lorenza

texts.es: Lorenza con su credikiva anterior compró mercancías variadas como cosméticos interiores y mercancía variada.  Que vendió y rotó muy rápidamente su inventario. En la actualidad se prepara para un nuevo financiamiento por Kiva porque aprovechará la temporada alta que viene en el mes donde hay celebración del día de las madres, del padre las secretarias y sus ventas se incrementan, por eso comprará cosméticos, ropa íntima, y ropa exterior. Ella dice a los financiadores de Kiva: “Gracias por el apoyo brindado y espero continúen apoyándonos”.
texts.en:
With her previous loan, Lorenza was able to buy various types of merchandise such as cosmetics, undergarments, and other products. She was able to sell and rotate her inventory very rapidly. At the moment, she is preparing to receive a new Kiva loan so that she can take advantage of the high season and the upcoming celebrations of Mother's Day, Father's Day, and Secretary's Day in order to increase her sales.

Lorenza will buy cosmetics, intimate apparel, and exterior clothing. She would like to say to the Kiva lenders, "Thank you for the assistance you provided and I hope that the support will continue."

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics, undergarments, and clothing.

loans.name: Magdaline

texts.en:
Magdaline is a 31-year-old single woman with two children. She distributes groceries and has a M-PESA business( which is known as local money transfer). Magdaline has been in this business for five years and earns a monthly income of KES 20,000. 

This will be her first loan with KADET LTD, she plans to use the entire loan to buy more onions and potatoes from farmers to distribute to her customers. In future, she wants to buy land and work in horticulture farming.

loans.use: to buy onions and potatoes

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 49 years old, married, and blessed with three children, ages 18, 22, and 24. She keeps poultry, a business she started five years ago, and she earns a monthly income of KES 45,000. 

She has requested for a loan of KES 50,000 to purchase more chicks and expand her chicken shelter. The anticipated profit will help her pay school fees for her children.  

Her dream is to excel in life through hard work. This is her third loan.

loans.use: To purchase more chicks and expand her chicken shelter.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a 29-year-old widowed man from Migori who is currently supporting his brother.

Charles operates a timber cutting business using a power saw in his home area. He has been in this business for the last five years and makes a monthly income of KES. 4,500. He is currently taking his first loan from KADET, LTD, which he will use to buy another power saw for splitting timber. His profits will be used to repay the loan.

His dream is to improve his extended family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy another power saw for splitting timber.

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en:
Priscilla is 40 years old, married and blessed with two children, ages 15 and 11 years respectively.  She runs a medical clinic which she started 10 years ago and earns a monthly income of 20,000 KES.

She wants to start a new line of business, a cafeteria  more specifically, and has requested a loan worth 30,000 KES to purchase bales of baking flour, 20 liters cooking oil, a sack of sugar and utensils to start another line of business. 

The profit she earns will contribute towards her buying a piece of land which is also her dream. This is her first loan.

loans.use: to purchase bales of baking flour, 20 liters cooking oil, a sack of sugar and utensils to start another line of business.

loans.name: Carmen Elena

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Mujeres Unidas se reúne cada quince días en la ciudadela San Alejo de la bellísima ciudad de Portoviejo, capital manabita conocida como la Ciudad de Los Reales Tamarindos, ciudad de gente hospitalaria y amable que ofrece muchos atractivos a cuantos la visitan.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Carmen tiene 49 años de edad, hace varios años su querido esposos falleció y quedó viuda pero de esa relación tiene 5 hijos, cuatro mayores de edad y el menor que tiene 17 años y estudia en colegio, dos de sus hijos aun viven con ella.

Nuestra amiga para salir adelante y para que no les faltara nada a sus hijos después de la muerte de sus esposo continuo con el negocio que él tenia, ella con la ayuda de sus hijos se dedica a la venta de arroz por saquillos o por quintales, ellos alquilan un carro y se desplazan hasta Charapoto lugar donde compran este producto de primera necesidad y que luego llevan a entregar a sus clientes, productos los cuales deja a crédito y va cobrando por semanas o quincenas, nos cuenta que por esta facilidades de pagos tiene muchos clientes.

Este crédito lo va a ocupar para comprar arroz. Lleva más de 2 años en el  Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos son de gran ayuda cuando los recibe.
 
Su sueño es compara un camión ya que los fletes se le llevan gran parte de las ganancias.
texts.en:
The “Mujeres Unidas” (United Women) communal bank meets every fifteen days in the San Alejo neighborhood in the very beautiful city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, and known as the “City of the Royal Tamarinds.”  It’s a city of hospitable, kind people that offers many attractions to visitors.

We met Carmen, 49, here.  Her beloved husband died several years ago and she was left a widow but she has five children, four adults and a 17-year-old who is attending high school.  Two of her children still live with her.

In order to get ahead and so that her children would lack nothing after her husband’s death, she continued with the business he had.  With help from her children she sells rice by the bag or quintal.  They hire a car and head out to Charapoto where they buy this basic staple to then resell to their customers.  She sells on credit and collects payment weekly or biweekly.  She tells us that she has many customers thanks to these easy payment plans.  She will use the loan to buy rice.  

She’s been in the communal bank two years and likes it because the loans are of great help when she gets them.  Her dream is to buy a truck because the transportation costs swallow up a large part of her profits.

loans.use: to buy rice.

loans.name: Frank

texts.en: Frank is a 32-year-old married man with one child living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He has personal goals of educating his children, buying a car and building a permanent house. He sells animal drugs and has been in business for the last five years. He has hardships of price fluctuations, inflation, customers not paying on time and inadequate capital to purchase stock. However, he has a vision of diversifying his business to include farming, hiring employees to help expand his business and expanding his business to a more permanent location. Frank needs a loan to buy animal drugs to sell.

loans.use: to buy animal medicines to sell

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip is a 25-year-old single young man who supports his parents and one of his siblings. He offers M-PESA services, which is a local money transfer service, and he has been in operations for over four years earning an income of 14,000 KES monthly. 

He joined a KADET LTD financial help group and is now requesting his first loan of 30,000 KES to add to his business capital. The anticipated amount will be used to start the same business in a different location.  

Philip's dream is to prosper in business and be able to support his family members.

loans.use: to increase business capital.

loans.name: Venansio

texts.en:
Venansio is a 38-year-old married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He has been operating a retail shop selling phones for the last four years. He faces hardships like inadequate capital to purchase stock. He has a vision of expanding his business to new markets and diversifying his business to include farming. 

Venansio intends to use the loan to buy phones for sale. His personal goals are to educate his children and build a permanent house.

loans.use: to buy phones for sale.

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua is 32 years old, married, and blessed with two children. To earn a living, he runs a shop. He works hard to provide for his family. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has managed to grow his business because he has been trained in business management skills.

Joshua hopes to expand his business into wholesale in the future. He has requested 40,000 KES to buy rice, kerosene, sugar, and cooking fat for sale.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more charcoal to stock and sell.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel is 41 years old and married and with three children.  He does vehicle repairs to earn a living. He employs two people in his business.  Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has managed to grow his business, because he has been trained in business management skills.  He has also managed to access financial resources easily.

Joel needs a loan of 100,000 Kenya Shillings to buy vehicle spare parts.

loans.use: To buy vehicle spare parts

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
Karen, a poultry farming business lady, is 34 years old. She is married to Daniel, a businessman. She has been keeping poultry for the past 12 years, earning a monthly income of KES 10,500, which she uses to support her family. 

She is applying for her first loan from  KADET LTD, after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Karen will use the loan to buy poultry feeds and chicks. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to export eggs.

loans.use: to buy poultry feeds and chicks.

loans.name: Johnson

texts.en: Johnson is a 29-year-old married man with three children living in Kasese, Uganda. His personal goal is to educate his children and build a permanent house for his residence. He has been selling clothes for two years. After starting with capital of 200,000 UGX, he now has 1,200,000 UGX in working capital. He has hardships of seasonal weather and inadequate capital to purchase stock. However, he has a vision of owning a boutique. Johnson wants a loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Judy

texts.en: Judy is 35 years old, married and has two children.  To earn a living, she runs a retail shop where she mainly sells plastic cups, bowls, cooking pots and plates.  She works hard in her business to provide for her family.  Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has managed to grow her business. Judy hopes to grow her business into a wholesale business in the future. She needs 100,000 Kenya shillings to buy cups, basins, cooking pots and plates.

loans.use: To buy cups, basins, cooking pots and plates

loans.name: Stephene

texts.en: Stephene is taking out another Kiva loan of KES 20,000 to boost his food stall business. With the loan, he wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, and rice. The previous loan enabled him to make enough profits to improve his standards of living. He dreams of purchasing a motorcycle to use in distribution of goods in the future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, and rice.

loans.name: Bahati

texts.en: Bahati is taking another loan of 50,000 KES to start a new business. She plans to buy chicks and chicken feed. The previous loan enabled her to build a poultry house. She aspires to erect another poultry house to expand her business. The previous loan enabled her to change her house from temporal state to permanent.

loans.use: to buy chicks and chicken feed.

loans.name: Sandra Elizabeth

texts.es: Sandra Elizabeth habita junto a su grupo familiar el cual está conformado por su esposo y su hijo Samuel que se encuentra iniciando estudios con kinder. Ella se dedica al comercio de ropa de manera ambulante en las principales áreas de la zona donde habita.  Sandra es muy trabajadora y emprendedora. Desde hace algunos años decidió poner su negocio  de ropa ambulante y en otros días también a sus clientes ofrece carne, es una mujer que tiene una alta autoestima, siempre busca aperturar oportunidades dado que los ingresos percibidos por su esposo no son suficientes para cubrir el gasto de las principales necesidades de su hogar. Es así como cada día se levanta muy temprano para realizar todas las tareas del hogar, atender  a su familia y luego se pone en marcha para realizar la venta en las zonas más cercanas de su comunidad. Muchas personas la prefieren  ya que es una mujer muy amable y responsable, pero lo más importante es que los clientes siempre encuentran lo que buscas  a los mejores precios. Su sueño es poder incrementar su inventario para poder aumentar sus ventas de tal forma que pueda incrementar sus ingresos y de esta forma poder ayudar de mejor  manera a su familia. Esta es la razón por la cual ha tomado la decisión de acercarse a esta institución para solicitar este préstamo el cual utilizará para invertir en la compra de  variedad de prendas de vestir  tales como: faldas, blusas, camisetas, pantalones, ropa interior, etc. de esta forma espera cumplir su sueño y confía en Dios todo poderoso que así será. Vale la pena mencionar que ella expresa estar muy agradecida con esta institución, INTEGRAL, ya que en el pasado le brindaron la ayuda que ella solicito para invertir en su negocio, espera que esta vez no sea la excepción.
texts.en:
Sandra Elizabeth lives with her family (husband and son Samuel who is beginning kindergarden). She sells clothing in the communities in the area where she lives. She is very hardworking and enterprising. 

A few years ago Sandra decided to start a business selling clothing. Some days she also sells meat to her customers. She has lots of self-confidence and is always seeking new opportunities to supplement her husband’s income which isn’t sufficient to cover household costs. So she gets up early every day to do chores, take care of her family, and then begin her job in the communities nearest to where she lives. Many people prefer to shop with her as she is a friendly, responsible woman--but the most important thing is that they always find what they need at good prices.

Sandra’s dream is to increase her inventory so that she is able make more sales and earn more money. She will then be in a position to help her family even more. That is why she decided to approach this institution to ask for a loan to buy a variety of clothing such as skirts, blouses, shirts, pants, underwear etc. In this way she will fulfill her dream trusting in an all-powerful God that all will turn out well.

It should be mentioned that Sandra is very grateful to the institution INTEGRAL as in the past it has provided her with assistance to buy clothing for her business. She hopes that this time will be no exception.

loans.use: to buy a variety of clothing like skirts, underwear, shirts, pants, blouses, etc.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a 36-year-old married woman with two children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house with no electricity or piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

Asha has been operating a retail shop for the past two years. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. She aspires to start a second retail shop.

With the KSHS 10,000 she wants to purchase additional stock of sugar and also a weighing machine for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of sugar and a weighing machine

loans.name: Rahab

texts.en:
Rahab is a 40-year-old farmer. She is married to Bedan, a businessman, and blessed with four children. Rahab earns monthly income of KES 15,000 from the sale of farm produce and milk. She has taken out her third loan from KADET LTD, after repaying the previous loans successfully. 

She will use the loan to pay for her children's school fees. With the accumulated profit from her farming business, she will buy more dairy cows, which will enable her to increase her monthly income after the sale of milk.  

Her hope and dream is to educate her children comfortably up to the university level.

loans.use: to pay for her children's school fees

loans.name: María Felicita

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Mujeres Unidas se reúne cada quince días en la ciudadela San Alejo de la bellísima ciudad de Portoviejo capital manabita, conocida como la Ciudad de Los Reales Tamarindos, ciudad de gente hospitalaria y amable que ofrece muchos atractivos a cuantos la visitan.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Teresa, tiene 55 años de edad,  está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos, dos de ellos ya son mayores de edad y profesionales, el menor tiene 17 años y está en universidad, dos de ellos aun viven en su casa. Su esposo es taxista.

Ella hace varios años  aprendió corte y confección en una academia de la localidad,  para ganarse la vida y con esto ayudar su esposo con los gastos del hogar desde hace muchos años se dedica a coser ropa, para lo cual instalo un pequeño taller de costura en su casa, allí confecciona todo tipo de ropa tanto de hombres, mujeres y niños,  pero confiesa  que lo que más le encanta es hacer ropa para niños, ella comparte su tiempo entre su trabajo y su casa, trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 21h00 y a veces hasta más tarde sobretodo en épocas de entrada a clases que tiene mucho trabajo, lleva más de 17 años con su taller y gracias a Dios nunca le falta el trabajo.
 
Este crédito es para comprar telas y otros materiales de costura. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace más de 13 años y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos.

Sus sueños son tener un gran taller de costura y buena salud para seguir adelante.
texts.en:
The “Mujeres Unidas” (United Women) communal bank meets every fifteen days in the San Alejo neighborhood in the very beautiful city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, and known as the “City of the Royal Tamarinds.”  It’s a city of hospitable, kind people that offers many attractions to visitors.

We met Teresa, 55, here.  She’s married and they have three children.  Two are professional adults now and the youngest is 17 years old and is attending university.  Two of them still live at home and her husband’s a taxi driver.

She learned dressmaking several years ago at a local academy.  To earn her livelihood and help her husband with household expenses she’s been sewing clothes for many years.  To do so, she installed a small workshop at home where she makes all types of clothes for men, women and children but she confesses that what she most enjoys is making children’s clothes.  She splits her time between work and home.  She works every day from 8am until 9pm and sometimes even later especially at the start of the school term when she has much work.  She’s been with her shop for more than 17 years and thank God never lacks work.  This loan is to buy fabric and other sewing supplies.

She’s been in the communal bank for more than 13 years and likes it because of the help they give her with the loans.  Her dream is to have a great sewing workshop and good health to be able to continue forward.

loans.use: to buy fabric and other sewing supplies.

loans.name: Petra

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Mujeres Unidas se reúne cada quince días en la ciudadela San Alejo de la bellísima ciudad de Portoviejo, capital manabita conocida como la Ciudad de Los Reales Tamarindos, ciudad de gente hospitalaria y amable que ofrece muchos atractivos a cuantos la visitan.

En este lugar vive la señora Petra, tiene 59 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tienen tres hijos todos ya mayores de edad, uno  de ellos aun vive con ella. Su esposo es guardián.
 
Ella hace varios años aprendió belleza en una academia de la ciudad y en sociedad con un hermano tienen un salón  de belleza en  la ciudad de Montecristi, allí trabajan todos los días desde las 9h00 hasta las 18h00, nos cuenta que ellos realizan todo tipo de trabajos en arreglo personal, cortan cabello, realizan tinturados, depilaciones, entre otras cosas, allí en su local también venden productos de cuidados y arreglo personal, así como también productos naturales para bajar de peso, llevan más de 5 años y comenta que les va muy bien porque su negocio está bien ubicado.

Este crédito es para comprar tintes, cremas, esmaltes y productos naturales. Lleva más de 16 años en el Banco Comunal, es socia fundadora y le gusta por los beneficios que ha recibido de la institución.
 
Su meta es tener su casa bien construida.
texts.en:
The “Mujeres Unidas” (United Women) communal bank meets every fifteen days in the San Alejo neighborhood in the very beautiful city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, and known as the “City of the Royal Tamarinds.”  It’s a city of hospitable, kind people that offers many attractions to visitors.

Petra, 59, lives here.  She’s in a common law relationship and has three children who are all adults now; one of them still lives with her.  Her husband’s a caretaker.

Several years ago she learned beauty at an academy in the city and in partnership with a brother has a beauty salon in the city of Montecristi.  They work there every day from 9am until 6pm.  She tells us that they do all types of personal care jobs; they do haircuts, hair coloring and hair removal, among other things.  They also sell beauty products, personal grooming items as well as natural weight loss products in the salon.  They’ve been in business more than five years and she comments that they do very well because the salon is well located.  This loan is to buy hair color, creams, nail polish and natural products.
 
She’s been in the communal bank for more than 16 years.  She’s a founding member and likes it because of the benefits she’s gotten from the institution.  Her goal is to have her house well-built.

loans.use: to buy hair color, creams, nail polish and natural products.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth has applied for her third loan from KADET LTD. She repaid her previous loans well and in good time. She will use this loan amount to purchase fertilizer and seedlings for use during this planting season.

She hopes to be a leading farmer in her area and give her child a better education.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer for planting

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Ana tiene 29 años, vive con Ronald, su hijo de 9 años, en su casa propia ubicada en el distrito de Huasahuasi – Tarma.

Hace 10 años que viene dedicándose a la agricultura, siembra papas y arvejas, las que posteriormente vende en el mercado central de su ciudad. Como una mujer emprendedora y capaz, hace 5 años decidió expandir su negocio, pues su hijo estaba creciendo y necesita mayores cuidados y dedicación; es así que con el dinero ahorrado adquirió dos parcelas. Ahora produce en sus propios terrenos y en otros que arrienda. “Cuando llega la campaña de arvejas se siembra hasta en cuatro parcelas, sí es rentable”, menciona.
Para más delante, ella está pensando comprar más terrenos de cultivo en los cuales podrá sembrar mayor cantidad de papa y otros productos. Así ahorrará al no pagar en el arriendo de terrenos y de esa manera podrá comercializar en la capital.

Éste es su préstamo número 2 que tiene con MFP. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Unión Huanchán”, del que se siente identificada por el trabajo solidario y responsable de todos.
Ana, con el dinero solicitado, podrá adquirir dos bolsas de semillas (con 1100 soles). Lo restante será para la compra de fertilizantes.
texts.en:
Ana is 29 years old, and lives with her son Ronald, who is 9 years old. They live in their own house in the district of Huasahuasi – Tarma.

Ana has been working in agriculture for over ten years, and she presently plants and harvests potatoes and peas, which she sells in the central market in her city. She is a very entrepreneurial woman who decided five years ago to expand her business, since her son was growing and needed more of her time and energy. She decided to purchase two parcels of land, and she now produces crops on that land, as well as on additional rented land. She says that, “When pea season arrives, we plant up to four parcels of land for the crop if it is profitable.” 

In the future, Ana is considering purchasing more land for farming, land that she would use to increase her potato production, as well as the production of other staple crops. She hopes that, with more land in her name and fewer rent payments, she will be able to generate more income and sell her products in the capital city.

This is her second loan with MFP. She is a member of the community bank, “Unión Huanchán,” and she feels very connected to the group and identifies with their common goals and tasks. With the support from the loan, Ana plans to purchase two sacks of seeds (with 1100 soles). Any remaining funds will be used to purchase fertilizers.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity is a 43-year-old poultry rearing farmer. She is a single mother of four children. She has been in the poultry rearing business for the past 12 years with the monthly income of KES 15,000, which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD, after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Charity will use the loan to buy poultry feed and chicks. 

With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to own a big poultry farm which will help her improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: to buy poultry feed and chicks

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 38 years old, married, and blessed with six children aged 24, 20, 15-year-old twins, 13, and 10 years respectively. She is a farmer, a practice she started twelve years ago, and she earns a monthly income of KES 12,000. 

She has requested a loan of KES 25,000 to purchase four bags of fertilizer, 10 kgs of maize seeds, and beans for the planting season.

The anticipated profit will aid her in educating her children. She hopes to continue with farming as well as educate her children. This is her fourth loan.

loans.use: to purchase four bags of fertilizer, 10 kgs of maize seeds, and beans for the planting season.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles has applied for his second loan from KADET LTD. He repaid his previous loan well and in good time. He will use the loan amount to buy another quarry site so as to expand his business.

He hopes to become among the top miners in his area and see his children through their education.

loans.use: to buy another  quarry site.

loans.name: Give It Back Group

texts.en:
Kadiatu is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Kadiatu was born in Kenema city 29 years ago. She is married to a businessman and the couple has two children, one in primary school and one in secondary school. Kadiatu sells clothes and has been doing this business for many years now. 

This is the first loan that Kadiatu and her group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and improve their living conditions. Kadiatu will use her share of the loan (1,200,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL)) to expand her business. She will buy ready-to-wear-clothes in large quantity to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy ready-to-wear-clothes in large quantity to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase stock for sale.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline, 26, is a single lady who supports her mother. She is a business woman who sells a variety of cereals. She has been in operation for three years earning a monthly income of 6,000 KES.  

Caroline is requesting her first loan, at 20,000 KES, from KADET LTD, which she intends to use to purchase bags of dry maize to sell.  

The profits will be used to repay the loan and venture into other business that will earn her some income. Caroline hopes to succeed in business and create a stable life for herself.

loans.use: to buy maize for sale.

loans.name: Jovia

texts.en: Jovia is a 49-year-old married woman living in Kamwenge, Uganda.  She has personal goals of educating her children and building a permanent house for her residence.  She is a farmer and has been farming for the last ten years. Her hardships include price fluctuation, inflation, and unpredictable seasonal weather changes; however, she has a vision of expanding her business to new markets and hiring employees to expand her business.  Jovia needs the loan to complete building her house.

loans.use: To complete building her house

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
