The organic fertilizer the system produces from the treated animal waste will be used in his orchard where he grows apples, pears, peaches, and walnuts in addition to corn, beans, and cactus.  Ramón will cut his chemical fertilizer usage by over 60% by making better use of the renewable resources available to him.

loans.use: To purchase a 4 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase canned goods, shampoo, soap, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en: Kennedy has four children, all of whom are attending school. He operates a bodaboda (motor cycle) and has been doing so for the last three years. He intends to use the loan of Ksh 30,000 to purchase some fuel and to service his motor cycle. His main challenge is the muddy roads during the rainy season. Kennedy lives in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. He aspires to hire employees in future. He joined Yehu to get loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase some fuel and to service his motor cycle.

loans.name: Josué

texts.en:
Josué lives on a small farm with his wife and son, and the animal waste from his cows and horses will be treated by his Sistema Biobolsa biodigester to produce renewable energy and organic fertilizer.  The energy-rich biogas will be used in the kitchen for cooking and heating bathwater, nearly eliminating their LP gas usage.  The organic fertilizer will be used in his orchard where he grows apples, plums, and a local fruit called tejocote often used to make punch.  He also grows nopal cactus year-round.  

Josué is excited by this investment because the organic fertilizer his system will produce will allow him to grow food for the first time in his life without chemical fertilizer, saving him at least 10,000 pesos a year on fertilizer alone.

loans.use: To purchase a 4 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester

loans.name: Constantino

texts.en: Constantino derives about half his income from farming and the rest from recycling waste materials that have a value as raw goods.  His Sistema Biobolsa biodigester will allow him to recycle more, processing waste from his pigs to use as fertilizer for his flower garden, his vegetable patch, and on his corn and bean fields. The biogas produced will benefit his family and the families of two of his children as he plans to connect their houses to the system as well. A chemist by trade, he is excited to integrate the technology into his household because he has seen the benefits of the biodigester in other households within his community.

loans.use: To purchase a 12 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tools for the maintenance and pay for the gasoline

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tools for the maintenance and pay for the gasoline

loans.name: Grisha

texts.en:
Grisha lives in Vani district in West Georgia. He is married and lives with his family: wife – Natela and three sons (22, 21 and 12 years old). Grisha works in a local concrete factory as a worker. Along with his main job, Grisha is actively involved in the family's agricultural business, which is the main source of the income for them. They have 700 nut trees and a vineyard with 700 wine trees. Grisha and his sons sell the harvested nuts and grapes in the local market. Their total average monthly income is 600 Laris.

Grisha requested credit to start up a sheep farm and a beekeeping business. With the received credit, Grisha will purchase five sheep and two beehives with bee colonies. Grisha won’t sell the lambs for couple of years and will breed the sheep.  After 2 years, he will start the sale of lambs. Also, he will sell honey in the village. The income for the family will significantly increase. They will be able to purchase additional household goods to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: buy sheep and beehives

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius is 39 years old from Nakuru and is a single man with no children yet. Julius has applied for his first loan from KADET LTD, to enable him to buy a dairy cow. He does dairy farming and will be able to produce more milk. He hopes to be able to open a dairy shop in the near future.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Sohoueto Group

texts.fr: Le groupement SOHOUETO est composé de treize personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. C'est la deuxième fois que ce groupement sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupement, du nom de Viviane est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Viviane est âgée de 40 ans et vit au Bénin. Viviane est mariée à un chauffeur du nom de Séverin. Le couple a trois enfants à leur charge, tous scolarisés. Viviane vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les divers besoins de la maison. Afin de répondre efficacement aux besoins de sa famille, Viviane vend depuis cinq ans des biscuits en gros  et de façon secondaire des produits cosmétiques à son domicile ou par le système de distribution. Viviane s’approvisionne dans un marché du Benin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Viviane sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupement SOHOUETO, un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le premier prêt a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
SOHOUETO is a group of thirteen people who live in the same neighborhood. This is the group’s second time seeking financial assistance from ALIDé to bolster their activities. 

The group’s representative is Viviane, seen with her hand raised in the photo. Viviane is 40 years old and lives in Benin. She is married to a driver named Severin and they have three dependent children, all in school. Viviane lives with her husband and children, and the couple handle the various household responsibilities together. To that end, she started selling biscuits wholesale as well as cosmetic products five years ago, from her home and through the distribution system. She buys her merchandise at a market of Benin.

To achieve customer satisfaction and to increase her sales and revenue, Viviane is seeking a second loan from ALIDé together with the other members of the group SOHOUETO. This first loan was correctly repaid.

loans.use: to buy biscuits and cosmetic products for resale.

loans.name: Bidzina

texts.en:
Bidzina is 53-year-old farmer. He lives in a small village in the Khobi District with his family: wife Rusiko, 28-year-old son, daughter-in-law and 4-year-old granddaughter. Bidzina’s son works in the local division of the Security Police. He gets a monthly salary.

Bidzina and Rusiko lead the agricultural business of the family. They run a family-owned small dairy and pig farm. In particular, there are 6 milk cows and a pig on the farm. Bidzina and Rusiko produce traditional West Georgian cheese and sell it on the local open market. Along with the above mentioned, the family owns 3 hectares of agricultural land where maize is grown. Bidzina uses part of the harvested maize for feeding the domestic animals and the other part is sold on the local open market as well. The family members are busy during the whole day, especially in spring and summer periods, with seasonal agricultural work. Total average monthly income of the family is 1,000 Laris. 

Bidzina requested credit for renting a tractor for tilling the land. Also part of the credit he will use for purchasing fuel for the tractor. After tilling the land, he will sow maize. Bidzina and Rusiko will work hard during the whole spring and summer to get a good harvest and to sell it at a convenient price. The family will use received profit for financing family daily needs.

loans.use: to rent a tractor and purchase fuel for tilling the land
